Old habits die hard. Are you alright?
Not that young. It's been a long time since you've called me that.
How are you feeling, young man?
How? As Batman, knowing she wants me? Or as Bruce Wayne and hope...?
Perhaps. Perhaps not. Why not ask the lady?
She's the first woman in a long time that's... No. She's the first woman ever. And she loves Batman. Not Bruce Wayne. If I let go of Batman I'll lose her.
Dr. Meridian...
Could I let Batman go? For Dick. For me. Could I leave the shadows? Have a life. Friends. Family...
Why, indeed?
Why do I keep doing this?
Jack Napier's dead. My parents are avenged. The Wayne Foundation contributes a small fortune to police and crime prevention programs.
Which `they' might that be, sir?
Maybe they're right.
I shall be near at hand. Should you need me. And sir, I know it's difficult but try and have a good time.
Too much wealth. Too fast. Half of Gotham zombied-out. A technology that self destructs. He's protecting more than industrial secrets, Alfred.
_No_, sir. _The_ _other_ _car_!
The _Rolls_?
Not the Jaguar. The _other_ car.
He boosted the Jag?  Is that all?
Actually, he took the car.
He ran away?
I'm afraid Master Dick has... gone traveling.
Is he all right?
Sorry to bother you, sir. I have some rather distressing news about Master Dick.
Don't be ridiculous.
No. You said I. I killed them.
He killed them. Two-Face. He slaughtered that boy's parents.
What did you say?
It's happening again. Just like my parents. A monster comes out of the night. A scream. Two gunshots. I killed them.
Take any three you like. After you get settled we can...
Ninety-three, including the sauna.
Gee, I'm not sure.  Alfred? How many rooms? Total?

I remember the bat, though. His scream. Those eyes. i was sure the fear would kill me.  In time I came to believe that if I became a monster, that if I was feared, I wouldn't be scared anymore. I was wrong.  They think I became Batman to fight crime. I became Batman to fight the fear. And instead I became the fear.
I don't know, sir. Your dear parents.  Suddenly gone. So much loss...
...The night Batman was born.  What was I doing in the fields that night, Alfred? What sent me running out into that storm? I keep dreaming about it but I just can't remember.
Your parents' wake. Rain fell like tears.
Do you remember the night I fell into that cave and the bat chased me?
Apology hastily retracted.
I wonder if she'd go out with me.
If I misinterpreted your interest in the lady, I humbly apologize--
She has an excellent mind.
Scholarly research?
I believe you said the same thing about the Batmobile.
It'll never work.
A few hitches sir, but I'm confident we'll have a prototype in no time.
How's the sonar coming, Alfred?
Hardly a worry, sir.
Then you'd have nothing to complain about.
...Would it be a terrible imposition to ask you to take better care of your equipment?
It's a wonder you sleep at all.
I think they're getting worse.
The dreams again, sir?
Four seconds from...
Just checking, young sir.
Up here, Al.
Master Wayne's dead wives.
How come this is the only locked door around this museum? What's back there?
May I help you, Master Grayson?
Big house. How many rooms?
Al?
How ya doin', Al?
Welcome, Master Grayson. I'm Alfred.
Did Two-Face call him Bruce?
Help Chase. I'll be back.
Maybe you just haven't met the right woman...
I haven't had much luck with women...
You like strong women. I've done my homework. Or do I need skin-tight vinyl and a whip?
You are direct, aren't you?
We could give it a try. I'll bring the wine, you bring the scarred psyche.
I'm not the kind of guy who blends in at a family picnic.
My life's an open book. You read?
We all wear masks.
I don't mind the work. Pity I can't see behind the mask.
Try a fireman. Less to take off.
Now black rubber.
What is it about the wrong kind of man? In grade school it was guys with earrings. College, motorcycles and leather jackets.
It's the car, right? Chicks love the car.
A girl cannot live by psychoses alone.
Are you trying to get under my cape, Doctor?
I wish I could say my interest in you was purely professional...
Last night at the circus. I noticed something about Dent. His coin. He's obsessed with justice. It's his Achilles' heel. It can be exploited.
What's wrong?
He's home. I sent the signal.
I didn't know that. See? You _are_ interesting. And call me Chase. By the way, do you have a first name? Or do I just call you bats?
Bats aren't rodents, Dr. Meridian.
Let's just say I could write a hell of a paper on a grown man who dresses like a flying rodent.
Why's that?
I'm flattered. Not every girl makes a super-hero's night table.  You might have some interesting insights into Two-Face.
...dual personalities. Abnormal psychology. Washington's poster child for the criminally insane. I read your work.
And you are?
_Two_ million dollars waiting to be transferred from the _Second_ Bank of Gotham on the _22nd_ How could Harvey? _Two_-Face resist?
Exactly!
Oh please. You're blind as a bat.
I see without seeing. To me, darkness is as clear as daylight. What am I?
For _me_? Really? Tell me.
Wait. I have a riddle for you.
Excellent. See. Who says a guy in a rubber suit can't be smart? Well, it's been grand. Sorry you all have to die now.
Death.  Death. Without taste, sound and all around us.  Because there is no way for me to save them or myself. This is one giant death trap.
No more tricks, Edward. Release Chase and Dick. This is between you and me.
Welcome to my parlor said the Riddler to the Bat. How's tricks?
Actually, I like to divest just before a major re-capitalization.
I notice you've sub-divided your B coupons. Feeling a little light on principle?
Banzai.
Rinka.
Slanta.
La'chiem.
Nostrovia.
No grape could be more intoxicating than you, my dear. But we make due. To your charms.  Skol.
Gracious even in defeat. How vaguely disappointing. When all this could have been ours together.
What? Oh, it's very impressive.
The press were just wondering what it feels like to be outsold, outclassed, and generally outdone in every way...  And what light through yonder window breaks? `Tis the east. And you are...
What? Oh, Edward. Hi. Congratulations. Great party-
So glad you could come.
No. Don't leave me! My invention! I need you!
We'll talk some other -
Wait. You can't go.
Call my secretary, she'll set something up.  Factory looks great, folks.  Keep up the good work.
Precisely. What's on all our minds? Brainwaves. The future of Wayne Enterprises is Brainwaves!
Mr. Nygma, you'll forgive me for being rude. But what exactly is on your mind?
What? Ah yes. Of course. I'm sorry. It's just that...you're my idol.  And some people have been trying to keep us apart.
I'm gonna need that hand back, Ed.
Nygma. Edward Nygma. You hired me. Personally. Just like I tell everyone.  Well, we've never actually met, but your name was on the hire slip.
Um...I'm pretty sure I'm Bruce Wayne. And you are?
Bruce Wayne. In the flesh.
Chase. There's something I need to tell you--
What are you talking about?

I always thought it was the bat that scared me that night that changed my life. But it wasn't. The real fear was hiding underneath: what I read in the journal, that my parents' deaths were my fault. That's what I couldn't remember. That's the crime I've been paying for all these years.
What?
...Not the bat?
Oh God, Bruce, you were a child. You weren't responsible.
The last entry read, Bruce insists on seeing a movie tonight.  Bruce insists. I made them go out. I made them take me to the movie. To that theater...  It was my fault. I killed them.
You do know. Try.
I don't-.
What does it say? What hurts so much, Bruce? What does the book say?

My parents are laid out in the library. Their skin smells like talcum powder. I'm so small. My father's diary is on his desk like always. I'm opening the book. Reading. I'm running out into the storm. The book is in my hands. I can't hear my screams over the rain. I'm falling...
Stop fighting.
I don't want to remember!
Your memories are repressed. They're trying to break through. Relax. Try to remember-.
Okay, tiger, take it slow. You going to give me your pin or something?
There's something I want to talk with you about. It's...Well, we.. I...
Excuse me, boys. I'd hate to stop this testosterone flood on my account-
And the beast slouches towards Bethelem.
Spare me the diagnosis, okay? You're being ridiculous. I can't be jealous of Batman.  Can I?
Oh God, Bruce. You're still jealous.
So how goes your `scholarly' pursuit of Batman?
Touchy, touchy.
Keep me off the couch, Doc. Your fees are a little rich for me.
If I didn't know better, I'd say you were sulking.
Rage. Anger. Passion. Pain.
In a sense we are all two people. The side we show in daylight. And that side we keep in shadow.
You want me close but you won't let me near. What's the terrible, dark secret you're protecting everyone from?
I'm not-
Throw up that ridiculous superficial mask. If you're jealous...
What?
Why do you do that?
What do you want me to say? That I'm not attracted to him?
I'd say this goes a little beyond taking your work home.
Come on, Bruce. This is what I do for a living.
Why do I feel like the other man, here?
Find anything interesting?
They've changed. The dreams, I mean. There's a new element I don't understand. A book. Black. Covered in leather....
And now....
A lot of what happened is jagged. Pieces missing. I can't really remember. I just get flashes. Usually in my dreams. I'd kind of gotten used to them. At least accepted them....
Sorry. I haven't even had time to unpack. Instant coffee okay?
The style of the letters I'm getting matches those found at the crime sites. Why would The Riddler be sending me riddles?  Who's your decorator? U-Haul?
I said I'm sure he did.
What?
He sure did.
You could say he kind of dropped out of the sky and bang-. I think he felt it too.
Fast work. You just moved here.
Well, I met someone...
But...
Bruce, much to my surprise, you seem like a really great guy...
Look, I'm rock climbing Sunday. How about coming along?
Don't believe it. I'm just skin deep.
The glib, cavalier routine, it really is an act, isn't it?
Me? I'm easy. Especially after a couple of martinis.
I don't get you Bruce Wayne.
That kid is amazing.
What? This isn't normal?
Like normal folks.
I'm sorry. Who are you?
I'm surprised you aren't blind by now.
And into a black dress.
Excuse me.
But I'm going to have to get you out of those clothes.
Would you? I'm not so sure.
Look, I'd love to keep chatting-
That's usually my line.
No insights here, doc. Just trying to get comfortable on your couch.  Oops. Times up.
You understand obsession better than you let on.
To kill me.
The letter writer is obsessed with you. His only escape may be...
It's a stretch but I'll manage.
Not much.
What do you know about obsession?
So, this Riddler, he's dangerous?
I think the question would be, do you have a thing for bats?
Exactly.
So what you're saying, this guy's a total wacko, right?
Patient apparently suffers from acute obsessional syndrome with potential homicidal styles. Work better for you?
Wacko? That a technical term?
My opinion. This letter writer is a total wacko.
Me? No. Only things that need calming in my dreams are the Rockettes.
She's a Malaysian dream warden. She stands sentry while you sleep and calms your dreams.  Need one?
Still play with dolls, Doctor?
On occasion. Usually at night.
The infamous Wayne charm. Does it ever shut off?
Just ones this beautiful.
Psychiatrists make you nervous?
Somebody's been sending me love letters. Commissioner Gordon thought you might give me your expert opinion.
How can I help you, Mr. Wayne?
Chase is coming for dinner. Why don't you join us.
Bruce, you can't.
Exactly. And once you'd killed him you'd be lost. Like me.  All this has to be a choice. Otherwise...it's a curse.
And when you finally get Two-Face?
But what about all the good we can do? There are monsters out there. Gotham needs us.
Dick, let go. Revenge will eat you alive. Trust me. I know.
You can't-.
I saved your life. You owe me. So either you let me be your partner or I'm going after Harvey on my own.
We don't kill. Killing is what damns you. It-. What am I talking about? This conversation is over. You're going away to school.
...I missed Two-Face by a heartbeat. When we catch him, you gotta let me kill him!
How about Richard Grayson, college student?
You have a real gratitude problem. You know that, Bruce? I need a name. Batboy? The Dark Earl? What's a good side kick name?
What the hell did you think you were doing?
Save the sermons about how great you want my life to be, okay, Bruce? If it weren't for Batman my parents wouldn't be dead. You don't get it, do you? This is all your fault.

You don't understand. It's an addiction. You fight night after night, trying to fill the emptiness. But the pain's back in the morning. And somewhere along the way it stops being a choice.  I want better for you.
Back off, man.
What I do isn't about revenge.
Me and my brother Chris were putting money aside so our folks could retire. Dad's knee was going. Chris was engaged, you know that? Two-Face took...everything. Now I can pay him back.
Absolutely not.
I need to be part of this.
Look, spare me the sermons, okay. You're just some rich guy who is trying to do a good deed. You don't even know me.
Listen, Dick. Killing Two-Face won't take the pain away. It'll make it worse.
I got no place at the circus without my family. I'm going to get a fix on Two-Face. Then I'm going to kill him.
Where will you go? The circus is halfway to Metropolis by now.
I figure telling that cop I'd stay here saved me a truckload of social service interviews and good will. So no offense but thanks. See ya.
Excuse me.
Okay. I'm outta here.
You're right, Edward. I didn't mean to be impolite. Please.
Can't tell if you don't say please.
Who is The Batman, Edward?
Yesssssss. I know!
Dr. Burton tells me you know who Batman is.
How could I forget?
It's Dr. Meridian. Chase. Do you remember me?
Who is it?
Edward...
Of course you are. And what a grand pursuit you must be.  What do you think of my new invention?
Chase?
I don't think so.
...Fired...your fired...your fired. You understand?! Fired!!

Yo. Charlie. Gimmie an order of brain deep-fry. Extra well done. Hold the neurons.  Patient exhibits symptoms of psycho neural overload. Notation: obviously higher settings can be dangerous to the subject.  Riddle me this, Fred. What is everything to someone and nothing to everyone else? Your mind of course. And now mine pumps with the power of yours.  New from Brain-bok. Da pump. Think faster. Reason higher. Out-cog-nate every homey on the court of life. Da pump. Yeah.  Ho! Mark. I sense an odd penchant for the anagramatic. The acrostic. The crypto-graphic. What doth this bode? Answer me Marcutio, you little runt.  Fred, I must confess you were a wonderful appetizer. Simply divine. But now I yearn for a meal of substance. The main course. A wide and varied palette. Ah, to taste the mind of a hero. A nobleman. A poet.  A chick in a short skirt wouldn't be so bad either.
What the hell is going on here?
I'll show you it works.
Fred?
Hell. Might even bring old Stickley here a few extra bucks. Huh, Fred?
...The Box can change their lives.  Our stock coupons will spike.
Paranoid? The psychotic?

Why be brutalized by an uncaring world? My RES Box will give Joe Q Public a realm where he is king.  Not that someone like you would need it. Someone so intelligent. Witty. Charming. But for the lonely, the...
Let me ask you something, Bruce. What is man's greatest tool?
I really do apologize, Mr. Wayne. His project was terminated this morning...
Never heard of a double-cross?
Wait! You said you'd let me go!
Just call us Harvey. Can we get you a sandwich? A soft drink? Given all the trouble we caused you, how about we cut you in for a share of tonight's haul?
Uh, yeah. Thanks, Mr..uh...Face.
That floor has got to be very hard. Is that better?
The coin _wants_ to decide.
Please. I swear I won't say noth-
...or death.
What say we flip for it?
I got family. ...Please.
Might. Might not. Could say we're of two minds on the subject.
...You gonna kill me?
_We_ sure are.
You sunk my battleship.
A hit.
A miss. And my favorite vitamin, I might add.
Miss.
Oh yes, and certainly _WE_ will!
We want to dust him. We truly want to dust him bad.
You're a genius.
Go ahead. You can say it.
Kill me? Well, alright. Go ahead. Take the empire. All yours.  Hell, Harv, old pals. I'll kill me for you.
Why do we need you? You only come between us. We can be the smartest person in Gotham City. We want the empire for ourselves. Time's up, laughing boy.
Everything.
About what?
Oh my God. Jim Morrison was right.
Don't bogart that 'trode.
Not until you do that thing I like.  On se tue pour des mesnonges. J'ai gache ma vie...  Woah. Harsh toke.
Haven't you had enough? Don't Think And Drive.
Sure, E = MC squared. Until you factor in more than three dimensions. Then... Damn. Hit us again.
Here. Get a good seat.
Where are you sending Batboy this time?

Addictive isn't it? Just Say No. Until I say yes. A little fringe benefit of working with me. Now here's the concept, counselor. Crime. My I.Q., your AK-47. You help me gather production capital so I can produce enough of these  to create an empire that will eclipse Bruce Wayne's forever. And, in return I will help you solve the greatest riddle of all. Who is Batman?
No.  Wait...
So not everyone can be a poet. Still, I respect the sentiment.
Holy shit.
Let's see if you bleed green.

Harvey. You need me. Since you've gotten out of Arkham, you've managed, what? To bungle stealing a safe? Wreck a statue? And, correct me if I'm wrong here, but weren't you outsmarted by an acned acrobat at the circus?
A man with a death wish.
Yet so bright and chipper and conservative!  It's so you.  And yet so _you_!  Very few people are both a summer _and_ a winter. But you pull it off nicely.
Congratulations. You get to die on the dean's list.
You _are_ Two-Face, you would need to face both rivers, both uptown and downtown simultaneously. Only one spot in Gotham serves these bi- zonal, bi-coastal needs...
How'd you find us?
I will <u>never</u> sell this house. I'll be buried in my yard next to Barbara.  Holding hands!  And a good paintbrush!
Get <u>away</u> you little monster.
Does that mean you'd consider it in two weeks?  You don't have to answer now.  He wants me to check the deed restriction anyway.  You take your vacation, Adam.  Say 'bye!
So do I, Jane.  I'm on vacation.

Adam my booyy!  When you're really rich in what matters...  ... nothing matters!  My buyer has just made a killing in condos in the Village.  And he's got a little stress problem...  ... so his wife says they want the old peace and quiet!
We're rich in what really matters.
You'll be rich!
No, Jane.
Maybe I am three-eighty-five if you carry a second lien!  I can arrange the most creative financing in the six states of New England.
All right.
Oh, Adam, don't tease her.  You never got an A in science in your life!
Give or take a year.
3:30 I guess.
What time is it?
Just a hunch.
What...?
What makes you think she likes me?

We've been given a gift here, honey.  A real live little girl. She likes us a lot.  She needs us. Maybe that's why we died so young, to keep us from getting so... attached to <u>things</u>.  The house, antiques, your model.  Look at us. We didn't have room for anyone.
You can build another one... with her.
Let's see if she can get my model back.
Ah, Adam, you don't know anything about little girls.  She's just... missed out on some love, that's all...
Little black party dresses?
You know, I've been thinking.  I could teach Lydia to sew.
... we wouldn't have had our little accident.

Lydia, believe me... we know... all the hard stuff is the same over here.  You're going to be who you are... whether you're alive or dead ... and over here -- it's... It's flat... there's no food, no colors ... you can't smell the flowers.  If we knew then what we know now we'd have been more careful...
I didn't --
<u>Adam</u>!  Why did you build a whorehouse?  Have you ever been to...?
But he didn't.  We've got him where we want him.
He might have hurt somebody.
Maybe they'll leave now.  That snake was a pretty nasty customer.
Who did the sushi?
N... No,  I just did the Ink Spots.
The sushi?  I did the wine. Didn't you do the sushi?
And your sushi was remarkable.

I don't care, I've changed my mind.  ... I feel <u>really</u> confident.  We're getting better at this stuff.  We can scare them off ourselves -- tonight!  I've got an idea.  You're going to love it... I'm going to hate it.
But <u>we</u> let him out.
I am not going to expose that little girl to that... pervert down there.
Honey, I think that was a mistake.
No, we don't.  We can work something out ourselves.  We just have to try harder.
Go?  What d'ya mean?  We need help.
Honey.  Let's go.
... acts like she's thirty-five.
She's only fourteen...
Maybe we should knock first?
I guess we open it.
Oh, Adam.  I don't have gloves.  My nails keep getting longer.  I'll break them.
Has anything been simple so far? From the look of the shovel, we dig.
Bet... el... geuse.  What an awful name.  I thought it was like -- you know.  The <u>juice</u> of <u>beetles</u>.
Three times.  Powerful number.
What happened?
<u>Betelgeuse</u>!
Go ahead... third time's a charm.
... Yes this must be him.  Look... Betelgeuse... Betelgeuse...
I didn't do that one... Hmmm.
Here's something.
Then it should be here.
Of course I did.
Did you copy these gravestones right, Adam?
This is different.  Eventually she'll take someone to the attic. And then what?  We've got to try to contact this guy Betelmyer. We gotta get some help, hon.
Adam, you had a photo of Big Foot!
She's got <u>photos</u>, Barbara.
Lydia's trying, but they don't believe her.
You know you're really a pretty girl.
Where are your skulls and bones?
Well, I don't know... We don't get many visitors.
It's <u>not</u> stupid.  We're ghosts. Do you want this woman for breakfast for 125 years?  Moan louder!
I feel really stupid.
Think of them as death shrouds. And the moaning is important. Really <u>moan</u>!  Practice, practice, practice.
God, this is so corny.  Have we been reduced to this?  Sheets?
Look, she's right.  We'll just start simple, honey, be tougher. I feel... confident.  C'mon.
That guy is in our cemetery.  Oh, Adam.
We probably wouldn't mind sharing the house with people who were --
We'd like some help in getting rid of the people who moved in here.  Barbara and I worked very hard on this house.
How long do you suppose we were waiting?
Look at this, everything is different down here.  All our furniture is gone.
My God, we're back where we started.
No.  But it's somewhere without big worms.
... Not what I expected when we walked through that door.
Wait.
Yet another triumph for Adam and Barbara in the afterlife.
Draw door?  I don't know why we keep looking in that stupid book.
We need some help.  I found something this morning.  Here. Emergencies.  'In case of emergency, draw door.'
I don't know... what are you looking up?
Are you crazy?  She can't hear you.
We don't know who he is...  ... I'm going to talk to that little girl.
What about this Beetle guy?
We're not going to wait here like cornered animals.  I can tell you that.  We need help.  I'm going to talk to that little girl.
There's nothing we can do.  It's just a matter of time before they unlock this room.  There goes my model.  There goes our last refuge.
That's all we need.
But she <u>saw</u> us.  I could feel it.
She couldn't have.  We can't <u>make</u> them see us.
That little girl saw us.
Nothing.  The bio buster?  I don't get it...
That's it?  No number, or instructions?
Not really...  what's this?
Look in the index... maybe there's, like an emergency number or something.
Death didn't improve your sense of humor.
You can't say that for sure.  It could be a transitional thing. Like a post-life crisis.  We just have to be tougher with them. Come on.  Have some brandy. Spirits, get it?
We're trapped in this house forever... with those... people.
I know.  I'm sorry.
<u>You</u> left me.
Oh, Adam, don't ever leave me alone.
Whatever it is it can't be worse than this.
Barbara, honey!  Don't go out there.  You don't know --
No, I'm not putting up with this.
Oh, honey, we may need that.
We're not completely helpless. I've been reading the book. There's a word for people in our predicament, honey.
I don't know if there's anything we can do.
Is this a punishment for something we did in life?  What can we do?
They make gypsies look good.
Adam, we <u>are</u> in hell.  I hate these people.
That's my girl!
I guess... if I'm going to be dead, I'll just have to be the best dead person ever!
At least we won't have to worry about her.
Arrogant.  That's Jane Butterfield all right...
Just says 'won't.'  Wait a minute. Here it says 'the living are arrogant... they think they'll never die, so they refuse to see the dead.'
Won't?  Or can't?
She can't see you, right?  In the book, Rule Number Two: the living usually won't see the dead.
I don't know.  <u>Jane, Jane, up here</u>!
What's she doing here?
God, it's Jane Butterfield!
But I'm not hungry, are you?
Dishes?  We haven't eaten in three weeks!  Adam, I'm not like you, I really need to be around <u>people</u>, get out to the church and go grocery shopping.
Hon... I didn't want to die, but really, this is fine with me.  As long as I never have to wash dishes again.
In heaven there wouldn't be dust on the wallpaper.
Maybe this is heaven.
I can't clean anything.  The vacuum is out in the garage.  I can't leave the house.  Why don't they tell us something?  Where are all the other dead people in the world?  Why is it just you and me?
Cabin fever, hon?

I don't see anything about 'Rewards and Punishments' or 'Heaven and Hell.'  This book reads like stereo instructions!  Listen to this... 'Geographical and Temporal Perimeters... Functional perimeters vary from manifestation to manifestation.'  This is going to take some time.

There are a thousand things... Why did you disappear when you walked off the front porch?  Is this a punishment?  Are we halfway to heaven or are we halfway to hell? And how long is this going to <u>last</u>?
This book isn't arranged that way. What do you want to know?
I don't like situations like this. I hate it when I'm not in control. So just tell me the basics.
This is going to take some time.
I don't think we survived the crash.
Look at the publisher.  Handbook for the Recently Deceased Press.
De<u>ceased</u>.  I don't know where it came from.
Handbook for the recently diseased.
Yes it did.  Yes it did.  I made a couple of small discoveries. Here's one.
Anything happen while I was away?
... Hmmm?
That's how long you were gone.
What?
Two hours.
You saved my -- uh -- life... or whatever... something.
Oh, Adam.  We're home.  In our own house.  Nonsense.  I'll make some coffee.  You get some more firewood.
I'll tell you what, Barbara.  I don't think we survived that crash.
I am sitting.
You'd better sit down, hon.
I'm not sure.  It feels... frozen.
How's your arm?

Ah, yes, you're the new boy from next door, ha ha!  My name's Lime. Harvey Lime. Welcome to Expediting.
Sam Lowry.
No, you can't have any more chairs! There's only one left in here now, and I need that to sit on!  Oh ... er, sorry. Who are you?

Numero une, crevettes ? la mayonaaise.

{suddenly unctious) Oh, but of course ...

Not now ... please
Mother? ... What ... what's ... you've got to help me ...
Sam!!!

It seems you're the first person ever to turn down a promotion. He thinks you should see a doctor.
I want to talk to him.

Is Mr Helpmann here?

Mother? Is that you?
Don't be childish, Samuel. Of course you want something. You must have hopes, wishes, dreams.
I'm sorry. I don' t want dessert. I don't want promotion. I don't want anything.
Sam ... you haven't had dessert.
Mother!

This isn't rare!

I hope you like it. It's very exclusive.
You're not listening, mother.
Mr Helpmann was very close to your poor father. He was very close to me. Still is. He'll take you under his wing at Information Retrieval. You'll like it when you get there.
No you're not. Jack Lint is a lesson to you - he never had your brains but he's got the ambition. You haven't got the ambition but luckily you've got me. And Mr Helpmann. Mr Helpmann was very close -

Er ... I assure you Mrs Buttle, the Ministry is always very scrupulous about following up and eradicating error. If you have any complaints which you'd like to make, I'd be more than happy to send you the appropriate forms.

Yes. Not my department ... I'm only records. It seems that Mr Buttle was overcharged by Information Retrieval. I don't think they usually make mistakes ... but, er ... I suppose we're all human.

Shirley and I come here regularly. I love romantic lingerie.

Numero trois, steak.  Monsieur, Mesdames, Bon appetit.

what? ... Oh ...

Why? I came into this game for adventure - go anywhere, travel light, get in, get out, wherever there's trouble, a man alone. Now they've got the whole country sectioned of and you can't move without a form. I'm the last of a breed. Ah ha! Found it!  There's your problem.
Well I suppose one has to expect a certain amount

The pace?

Do I have to remind everyone that in two days, we'll all be dead. The Cult of Good will be a memory. I don't want to hear about lawsuits or cereals. We have a secret mission...
Crowd always buys it. What do we got?

Sorry, sir. The Cult is my life and my life is the Cult. By God, Captain God, I shall not fail you..

You know, nobody likes you...

Be verwy, verwy, quiet; I'm hunting Catwomen.

This looks promising...

This ring belonged to my sister. I'd love for you to...
Somewhere very far away, very quiet, and very...  This is all wonderful, Selina, but...But I'm afraid I can not rest until all my sister's killers are brought to justice...That one-armed monster..

You're telling the truth. I can tell..How did this..
Hmm. Not bad.
What did you say?  Selina, sit down, the entire city is going crazy...You have to just calm down...
Tonight, somewhere in the city, innocent people will die--but then one of you knows that; for one of you is a vicious pirate-terrorist posing as the beloved superhero Captain God.
Uh Brock, today you are without me...
Exactly. I don't know what I'd do without you.
At some sanctimonious celebration of condescension. Nothing like appeasing half the population with a two hour luncheon.
Fine. You're angry. Don't be. The important thing is we're together now..
I got home fine. How's the "warehouse."
Selina, did you make it home, all right?  I tried calling, but your mother said that there was "no extension in the Hut." Whatever that means..
I'm sure.
Are you sure?
Your warehouse?  Go on ahead--to your "warehouse." I'll be okay...
This is insane. Let the heroes handle it.  I'd better get you home...I should check on my warehouse to make sure it hasn't been hit...
Well, it's just that I would think that the woman who is the real, non- imitation Catwoman would be pretty angry at some little amateur minx stealing the whole whip idea. Really angry.
What's the matter?  What are you saying?

No it's not.

Stop. We are not having a "duality" conversation. "Ooh, he has a secret side.  Ooh, she has a dark side." Please.  Duality is a joke. You get one, do you understand me?  You get one life. One shot. I'm so tired of women saying "I have an inner strength" or "Deep down, I'm really ambitious." "One day I'll design my own line of clothing and write children's stories, if I can only remember to return the videos I rented last night." If you are something, then you better be out there doing something.  You need to be the same bold thing in the day that you are at night--with maybe a slight clothing change. There is no gray area. The truth is not somewhere in between. There are two sides to every personality, all right--the reality...and the lie. We are not having a "duality" conversation.

I despise these kind of winds. Sorry, I guess I'm a little on edge. Seems this Catwoman has everyone, men and women, on edge. Don't you feel Catwoman says something about the duality of all men and women...
You're very special. Selina, I'm not a very good liar. I feel very strongly about you...forgive me use of architecture metaphors, but I instantly know a good foundation when I see one..
I checked out your stuff at the library.  Awesome work, really. Why would someone like you want to go out with a...with a..what exactly am I, again?
Hey, hey, the client comes first. You think I want my future children to know their Daddy created Frank's Fun Palace?
Oh, it's superb--I mean if you like that fascist nightmare kind of thing...
What did you think?
You designed Gotham Plaza?  The big silver guys pulling on those big silver things...
I'm not afraid. Are you?
There's a nice cafe down the street...unless you're afraid of this Catwoman prowling around. We can always dine at the mansion, if..
But of course you are. Dinner at Eight.  Wouldn't miss it.
Kincaid got a little frisky last night...So, meet here at eight and go from there?  By the way, I'm Brock Leviathan.
How heroic of you...

I was wondering, if you're not doing anything tonight...Would you like to go to dinner? I know; a tame suggestion considering the wide variety of miniature golf possibilities available to the Oasisburg citizen--but nevertheless, would you?
You're probably right.
I'll bet the butler's name wasn't "Jeff."
Nothing, just a jolt of deja-vu. I think I went out with a guy with a dignified British butler--can't remember how it turned out..
What's the matter...
I wonder..

Ouch. I hope you're not offended by aggressively curious men.
Guilty. I am.
You say that like an amnesia victim.

In women?
He likes you. Kincaid and I have always had similar tastes...
What little boy doesn't?

I've been looking for you.  Selina Kyle was right. One of us is a psychotic crusader.
I've been looking for you.
It may be time to get the police involved...
I can. That's not an admission of guilt,  It's just..I knew you had it in you...

Quiet, Blender Boy. I told you from the beginning, Selina, I'm not a very good liar. We're waiting.

You're right, I wasn't looking to fall in love with a casino worker. I'd given up trying to find anyone. But there was a fire in your eyes that cut right through the air conditioning and through the coldness of my heart.

I better go report this in...

Catwomen. Lots of them!
Wha-at?
God, can you hear me!

Boss, we better roll if we're going to hit this place, blow it up, and make that flight..

Priceless...We have a showdown in this alley, right?

You've lost all motor functions. The poison will kill you in ten minutes.

Will you please stop fighting?  Just let those people die so we can get on with our new lives together!  Trust me, one day we'll look back on this day and laugh. You got to admit, it's a lot more fun to be the villain.

Of course it matters!  It throws off everything!  "Superhero" is manhood's highest achievement. Manhood!  Your dirty little secret has diseased us to the core. Why are you--I fought for you with honor.  Why should it matter if I'm a man or a woman, as long as I'm a good warrior.
Just like a woman. You want out. You're out.
I want out of tonight's mission. I can't do it anymore, Captain. I can't let innocent people die to prove our superiority..I can't.
What's the matter with you, Spooky, my most trusted comrade?  We are warriors!  These are the challenges we live for!
I hate it when you get like this. This Catwoman is becoming an obsession. I say we call it a night. Tomorrow is a big day for us...

The Tranquilizer Tranquility will hold for about an hour..where is she? These women are out here on a lark-- Ladies Night at a discotheque.  It's not in their blood the way it is for Catwoman...Where is she?
Oh, I like her. I like her a lot. I want to save this one for later. Something that tasty you don't eat all at once. Go back to your alter- egos, we'll regroup in the morning.
You like them, don't you, Boss.
Just a homeless woman. Wrong place.
Well, you don't see that everyday. Somebody tell me what's the deal with Frida Kahlo here?
A bit sadistic, don't you think, Captain...?
Well, we spent enough time building the damn thing, might as well use it.
Now he'll be up all night...
Oh, I wish they wouldn't feed him like that.
You can't get away with..
Ah, the good guys always triumph in the end. It's what allows our children to sleep at night.

Do you have any idea how much superheroes get paid?  Zilcho. Urban vigilantes with secret identities operating outside the law. Not exactly the stuff of a W-2 form.  If it wasn't for merchandising and corruption and these diabolical "missions"...There is no such thing as heroes and villains, anymore, Selina.  There are only winners and losers. You lost. We won.
I'm supposed to be taking personality tips from you three?  You people were once heroes. You had ideals.  You fought for things.  Spooky told me so...

I know, I should probably tell you, but I just don't feel like it. To be honest, I'm really angry at you. I admired you so much more when you were purely wicked. I mean, look at you now, running around trying to "get to the bottom" of things. Trying to "save the city." It's true we're about to do a very nasty deed, but really, what's it to you?  Since when do you care what happens to a bunch of pathetic Oasiburgians? You're just not yourself, anymore.

How can you say things with such feeling and then turn around and put on a helmet and...Who are you?  Were you sitting on my right or my left at the card table?  Tell me!  Please tell me who you are; you own me that!
You've seen me...
You think so?...Selina?
I still have one left...
Yes. I am the reporter or the architect.  You've been through so much..It looks like you've used up all nine of your lives...
Oh please, sir, one more. Are you the reporter or the architect?

My, those little ears pick up a lot. The Cult of Good will die heroically preventing a world-class heist. Since we will be the ones performing the heist, our deaths will obviously be fake. But have no fear. There will be many other deaths tomorrow...and those will be quite real. I'm afraid these questions of yours put you in a position not unlike a long-tailed tabby in room full of rocking chairs.
A superhero's job is to protect.. Sorry, I can't take you seriously...I overheard you say that tomorrow the Cult of Good will be dead--I should be so lucky--what did that mean?
A superhero's job is to protect society.  Don't blame me if society is a horrible, corrupt joke.
It's a lot more fun than fighting violence with pamphlets. That voicebox of yours is a hoot. Say "I'm wearing no underwear"--it'll be funny..  You do know you're evil, don't you?
Hasn't anyone ever taught you that fighting violence with violence solves nothing.
And...your point?
You're not a super-hero. You're not even a hero. You're a scary, sick, fake who made a big mistake. You killed someone very special to me..
Hello, Rachel. I'm Selina.
You know, my name's not Spooky. It's, it's Rachel.
Save the City? I don't want to save the city, I want to move!  Listen, I'm sure the computer disc is pretty fascinating and I can't thank you enough for the little weird gold thingie, but..
The Mission is happening tonight..It's up to you to...to save the City...
Oh no, not a computer disc. A computer disc?  Oh man, come on, what do I look like?  I'm not a crime- fighter, I'm not a detective, what, I'm supposed to find some "clues" on this disc. I can't...
And I...I..want you to know our secrets..
For when the..Uh, yeah, thanks, a little gold piece of...gold. Uh...
For when the time comes..
Men, huh?
I heard what you said, Spooky. I can't believe he shot you...
You're not strong. You're scared..scared that someone like me will see right through you. Whatever the Cult of Good was, it's not anymore... You don't have to listen to me, just listen to you..
Can't you understand--I got tired of being a woman. I wanted the respect that only a cape, boots, chestplate, and a mechanical spear can bring..
Whatever you say...Sis.

I don't want to hurt you, Catwoman. Yet.  After tomorrow, you can do anything you want, but please, just stay out of sight for the next 24 hours. I won't stand by and watch my leader get all emotional over an animal like you. I warn you, don't tempt Captain God when he is angry. Let is complete our mission in peace.
Hello, Spooky.
Spear.
Spooky.
Ask me another one--
What's the name of your child's best friend?
How did you know our nanny's name is...Lucky guess!
You mean, "Consuela" is a good mother..
I'm a good mother!
Did you just say "girls?"
You Career girls have no idea what we go through.
You Housewives have no idea what we go through!
Kelly, get to work on those new uniforms.  I'm not running a summer camp here..
What if I were to say "Your Wife"-- as in does she know of your touching mentor-student relationship with the post-Bicentennial babe working the roulette wheel?
What if I were to say "You're Fired?"

Oh Frank, I'm not anti-male, I'm anti- you. Believe me, there's a difference.  Kelly is designing new uniforms for next week. Pay her and thank her. And is it a rule that the hottest places on the planet have the coldest air conditioning.  There's something out there called 73 degrees, look into it.
Hey, you're anti-male.
Can I be frank, Frank?  Your entire existence is sexual harassment. I accept there's not much you can do about it.
Oh, what?  I offer you a job in implied exchange for physical favors and suddenly it's "sexual harassment..."
Stop.
There you are, Selina. I've been thinking..I have some.."positions" opening up..
Yeah, as in born before..Ooh, I suppose it's "sexual harassment" to give a woman a compliment. Sheesh. Come on, gentleman...
Pre-bicentennial babe?
You know, Kyle, you're still pretty hot for a pre-Bicentennial babe...
What's the good news?
You're late. I've got some good news and some good news. I'm giving you more hours and the new uniforms came in.
I'll let you know.
We have to do something. What can we do to help, Selina?
Have you seen the Oasisburg Police? They drive golf carts with little red sirens.

Okay. Let's get serious. Of course I know the Cult of Good is not good. Ever since I saw what they did in Atlanta, it has been my mission to expose them. I've followed them to Oasisburg and soon will have enough hard evidence to bring them to real justice. That computer disc could be the final piece to the puzzle. This isn't just a story, Selina--another damn Pulitzer--this is my life.
You know, now that I hear myself tell it, I'm thinking maybe both of you are messing with me. What, you get the Helmet Monday through Thursday, then Brock takes it for the weekend...

Then there's you, Louis, sneaking through back alleys and surprise visiting me at my home..Both of you have been way too frisky from the get- go. I'm actually a pretty amazing person--funny, smart, attractive when I get my sleep--but you two had no way of knowing that-- when I met you both I was basically a morose, depressed amnesiac incapable of any human feeling. The only reason one of you wanted to go out with me is because you knew I was Catwoman.
Not too cool...

Lose the smile, Mr. Good Reflexes. We were having a pretty okay time the other night--good food, good conversation--some Catwomen show up and it's "You need cab fare?; I got to go to my Hideout--Oh, I'm sorry, I mean "warehouse."

Fine, fine, at a later date, I'll be more than happy to talk about my perverse psychological complexities with the one who's not the creep. But for now, I'm drilling inside your brains...I bring up the whole Catwoman thing for one reason.  I bit Captain God in the hand and the next day you both show up equipped with big bandaids and wobbly excuses--  "My grandfather is inventing a new kind of blender.."
Some reporter I am..all this time my story is right there in front..I have a lot of questions.
I'm not through. This will come as a shock. Again, to one of you. I am Catwoman. The Catwoman.
Hey, architect--she's joking. Right, Selina?  Selina?
Uh-huh..
You are...
You can't figure me out. You're the strange one..
I give up. I give up.--I can't figure you out. Not gonna try.
You're scaring me, Selina.  Do it some more.

Go together?  Sure, why not?  Another date with someone who could be an insane messenger of death for all I know. No offense. Hey, lean over, let me smell your breath..Say in a deep voice, "A superhero's job is to protect..."

I'm afraid last night was the last straw of our city's tourists. The Mayor, in his finite wisdom, is throwing a "Month of the Woman" luncheon ball for the public this afternoon to try and calm everyone down. I thought maybe you and I could...
Hey, I thought...

I was doing my job. At the risk of sounding egotistical, I didn't become the best reporter in the world sitting by the phone. I was chasing tail all night--I was not spying, intentionally, on your hot and heavy date with "Brock Leviathan, architect."  I can't believe he ordered white wine.  You do know white wine is not real wine...
I said I saw you last night. What were you doing hiding in that alley, running off when the superhero alarm sounded...
I'm having a hard time picking up your signal this morning--What did you say?
Like you don't know...

About the same. Thanks for asking...Damn blender.  Okay, I can't stand it anymore, I'm dying to know--Did you try on some whiskers last night and hit a 7-11 along with all those other women? You had to have thought about it--a Catwoman for a night?
Nothing. How's your hand?
What?
Did you try to kill...
Actually, yes.
Oh, do you turn around every time somebody just shouts at you?
Yes, you shouted the words "Captain God" at me for no reason...
You turned around!
What did--?
Hey, Captain God!
I thought you'd like a ride to work.  You don't own a cat, do you?
Next time, call...
Well. I'd let you come in, but the place is a mess...
No, of course not. You're listed. Not the hut, exactly, but the rest of..
Ah!  You scared me!  How did you know to come here!  Have you been spying..
Good morning.
Ah!  Ah!--God no, don't tell me you're one of those women who are attracted to ruggedly handsome and brilliant architects..
I am. Dinner with Brock Leviathan...
I was wondering, if you're not doing anything tonight...
But of course you are.
Oh the hand--my grandfather is inventing a new kind of blender and..You know, I realize I've never officially introduced myself...I'm Lewis Lane.
Oh now this one is mine...
Enough.
How much?
I actually got some memory back last night.
Sorry, I get carried away. Once I become interested in someone, I can't stop trying to figure them out...Amnesia victims are challenging..

Most articles focus on the first half of her name--describing some feline monster.  I want the woman of Catwoman. After all, if it was a man dressed as a cat, the story would be on page 23--just another loony. Oh, I want this one. I want her bad..
Yeah, she's okay.

What is it with women and Catwoman? Men have the courtesy to punish the weak, but women love punishing the strong. Don't get me wrong--this Catwoman is a terrifying, subversive menace to everything this community stands for and she must be stopped. It's just, I like her a lot.
I don't know what came over me.
Uh. "Thanks?"

A genuine woman of mystery in Oasisburg.  Amnesia. Bulletholes in exposed stomach badly concealed with body make-up.  Beautiful, intelligent eyes that have no business in "Frank's Fun Palace" or anybody else's Fun Palace for that matter..
I'll go out with you. Now go get me these old newspapers...
Okay, deal.
What if I say I'll go out with you, so you can have all these great daydreams, but then never actually talk to you again?
It's seeing-eye dogs, ma'am. If I let the cat stay, will you go out with me?
But I'm blind.
I'm sorry, ma'am, there are no pets allowed in the library...
Trust me, you won't have to.
I don't know if I can do it alone.
Do you always listen to what your mother says?  Selina. Something you choose your life. Sometimes your life chooses you.  Save the day..
But I'm not a hero. I'm nobody's heroine..I'm nothing. You've said so yourself many times.
Yes, you do. You have to go rescue all those people...
Mom, not now!  I, I don't know what to do..
I hate it when you let your hair just hang like that...you have such pretty eyes...
They're going to attack Frank's Fun Palace!
Yes, I'm pretty amazing. You should see this...It came this evening.
I never thanked you..the arrow..the motorcycle..the computer disc..You're so different from what I..and so the same.
What kind of name is "Brock Leviathan?"
Mom?  Oh Mom, I messed up...
It's because I didn't come in. I live in the Hut, now. I meant to tell you..See ya.
Where were you last night?  I didn't hear you come in.

Because she asked me--and I couldn't very well turn her down. Don't you remember-- of course you don't remember--that "Hag" is the one who brought you to that hospital in Gotham City. For what it's worth-- currently not much--we owe her your life...When I think about a single woman in Gotham City--amnesia is probably the best thing that could happen to a girl like you...Oh, don't forget your visor.
Uh, it's just--that woman out there-- that horrible Hag. She's the one who keeps following me on her creepy little scooter--And now she's built a hut in the back..Why did you...
Don't sneak up on me...
Oh, so now even the keepers of the city don't meet your standards...You're late.
I'll take your abuse, but it's way too early for the sanctimonious Cult of Gag...

Pretty good...Mom, I don't want you to think I don't appreciate...letting me stay, getting me the job--I've been a mess. I'm still a mess. It's just...we have to start having a different conversation. I can't take..

It's funny, I've heard of giving up finding a man and raising a family to pursue a career. And I've heard of foregoing a career to start a family-- but I think you're onto something new, Selina. "Absolutely nothing"-- Has a ring to it. I think it could catch on...How's that for sarcasm?
Maybe.
Is every single thing out of your mouth since your "accident" have to be a monotone mumble of cheap sarcasm?
Oh Mommy, you're embarrassing me.
Oh, I forgot to tell you, you're on a diet...The fact you're still reasonably pretty is the one thing you got going for you.
A hearty breakfast is the start of a great morning...
Yes, Mother. Dear.
You're late.
Thanks.
Nice breasts.
You going to talk all day?
You're the One. I thought I told you to stay hidden behind the couch, CAT! You've torn the unit apart.  You've driven a great leader insane...
The kicks..the rush..you mean, like pulling heists..faking your own deaths..killing innocent bystanders...like Mexican angels.  I know you're a woman. Do you?

I'm not sad, no, I owe the Captain my life. It's just you think you want to help prevent crime, but you realize that's too complicated. It's a lot more fun to punish crime. Then after a while, you don't care what's a crime and what's not, what you became a Warrior for. You just want the kicks. The rush.
You seem sad, Spooky.
We met on the Internet. The Captain put out a cryptic message calling for a new order of crimefighters. We don't even know each other's true identities...
What's it like being a superhero?  It must be frightfully exciting..How did you guys all get together?
Oh pooh, come now. If you turn me down, I just might throw a fit..you know how us girls can be..
I'm sorry, Miss, one of us needs to keep surveillance...
What's a powerful man like you standing all alone for?  Dance with me?
I call it blood, Detective.  If you want, you can call it graffiti.
What in the hell... do you call that?
Who ever made that.
And you're gonna tell me who.
Was. ALBRECHT  This isn't Top Dollar's style anyway.  This was somebody else. Somebody new.
He was a runner for Top Dollar. Just muscle.
Don't any of your little pals have real, grown up names?
This sack of shit is called Tin- Tin.
You know, you sure got a hard-on for a guy that's guilty of zip on paper.  Top Dollar runs Showtime; what's the matter, don't you like adult entertainment?
Sure it coulda.  Funboy's not here, neither is T-Bird -- none of Top Dollar's number ones.
They make you fart.
No onions?
No onions though, okay?
I'm buying.
You buying?
Care for a hot dog?
Talent. Hi.
Thanks, babe.
Don't thank me.
Well, hello there...chocolate,
You gonna wind up working at a school crosswalk.   that doughnut's chocolate you, know.
Could be.
I knew that.
Don't thank me.  Your ass is already in enough trouble for this shit.
Double homicide.  A year ago. Las Halloween.
Just don't tell me you "owe me one."  What file?
This is special, darlin'.  Please?
Speak up.  Clear it with the Captain if you need a file.
Annie, I need a file.
Whatever it is, the answer's no, Eddie.  I'm too busy tonight.
You're bleeding, man.  You can't make it.
Don't interfere.
The hell you say.  This isn't just about you any more.
Leave here.  Don't do this.  I don't want you here.
You're welcome.
This isn't your place.  This isn't your fight.  And I don't need your help.
You sorta looked like you might need my help.
No.  I have one more thing to do.
How 'bout the morgue?
They couldn't do anything for me.
Right.  You sure I can't just take you to the emergency ward?
I mean, I've done what I came to do.  It shouldn't hurt this much. But it will pass...
It's only fourteen or fifteen flesh wounds.
It's only a flesh wound.
Yeah, among others.  Hey, man -- you're hit.
Funboy had to leave this mortal coil.
It's done. ALBRECHT I figured as much.  Did you cap off Funboy.
My pleasure. ERIC Don't smoke these.
Thank you.  For giving a damn.
I should be trying to stop you.
Halloween is coming, soon.  You will have Top Dollar if you watch for me at the Showtime, tomorrow night.
Thirty hours.  A day of life, plus change...
I'm sorry as hell, man.
My name.
The venom of bad memories.  You were there; you saw her.  I saw you seeing her.
You okay, man?  I mean, what just happened.
You went out the window.  She was beaten and raped.  She died in the hospital.
I need you to tell me what you remember.  What happened to us?
You died, man.  I can't believe it but here you are.  Last year, you and your girlfriend --
I saw it, too.
You, my friend, are dead.  I saw your body.  You got buried.
The others are called Skank, T- Bird.  Street names.  Funboy.  Watch me, office Albrecht.
Fucking A, my friend.
I know Top Dollar has turned your streets into his hell.
You don't say.
Listen:  Top Dollar.  He "owns the street here."  He will "erase my ass."

You must listen carefully:  the Fire Department will be here soon. There is an injured man in the alley who needs assistance.  As Shelly Webster once needed your assistance, and as you are shortly going to need my assistance.
Are you nuts, walking into a gun?
No further.  I'm serious.
And I say I'm dead... and I move.
It can't rain all the time.
At least it finally stopped raining.
We'll discuss this later. Obviously.  You left the door open.
He was a present.  Besides, we're moving anyway.  You said.
I was wonderin' where you'd gotten to --  Oh, Elly, honey, a cat.  Here?
I lost my key.
I told you you're not supposed to come in here.
Mom --?
Not me.
Fun, he's not going away; he's scaring the piss outta me!
It's just the dope, don't worry
Fun -- look at that guy...
Oh wow, oh wow, don't fucking do that, man.  I nearly had a fucking heart attack.
Out.  Now.  I gotta work.
Hey, Darla -- before we die of old age, how about it --?
You mean you'll, like' dig your way out of the grave?  Euww.
I don't know if I can.  But you have this... and you know where to come.
You're not gonna come back, are you?
In a better place.  I hope.
Now do you get to see her? Shelly, I mean.
And she'll be alive.  Up here.
Shelly would've wanted you to have it.  This way, you'll think of her every time you see it...
I think he's yours, now.
I remember him!  Here, Gabriel... here kitty... Gabriel... Is he still yours?
Elly...
She's dead.  She's gone.  And now you're just gonna go away and never come back, too.  I hate this place; it isn't fair.
You brought flowers.  As long as you don't forget her, Elly, she lives.
A remembrance.  A closure.
What's going on...?
I have to go.
You gotta go now, I bet.
No.
Do you feel okay.
No name.  You sure ask a lot of questions.
Does she have a name?
Can you play "Teddy Bears' Picnic?"  It used to be her favorite.
I can pick out a tune now and again.
He has a room, upstairs.  I don't like him very much.
Mister Funboy lives there?
Mister Funboy.
Who?
My mom works over there.  I'm waiting for her, but she's probably with him, right now.
I dabble.  May I?
You look like a rock star without a job.
Oh.
Mom tried to cook.
Chili dog for breakfast... it's original.
She's still dead.
Well, how's your friend?
I went to see a friend of mine.
What's goin' on, Elly?
I need to find him kind of soon, Elly.
You buying?  He kinda wanders around.  You'll see him if you pay attention.
Right.
I'm looking for a good guitar man.
You're not a cop, either.  What do you want him for?
I'd like to get in touch with him.
I don't know you.
I know your friend, too -- the one that looks like a rock star.
Victims.  Aren't we all.
Holy shit... you're dead, man...
I don't know you...
I want you to tell me a story, Tin-Tin.
Hey, I got my rocks off, so fuck you in the ass, man.
You cut her.  You raped her.  You watched!
Last Halloween, eh?  Yeah...  Yeah, I remember.  I fucked her too, I think.
A year ago.  Halloween.  A man and a woman.  In a loft.  You helped to murder them.
Murderer.
Little early from trick-or-treat, homie.  This dick trying to bushwack me.
Rowdy.  Let me fill in some gaps for you.
I never forget anything, dickhead. That building was a sweep-and- clear; the bitch was a nuisance with her goddamned petition.  It got a little rowdy... end of story.
You don't even remember...
Who gives a fuck!  I'm a businessman.  You gonna do me, then do me and shut you're face!
It's yesterday!  Do you know what you destroyed?
That's ancient history.
A year ago.  A very nice lady circulated a petition.  She died. Last Halloween.  Answer yes or no.
Take the dope, too.
Do you know what you destroyed?
Five large, in the drawer right over there.  I never saw you.
Top Dollar, you're the only one here still wasting good air...
A whole club of pirates, with pirate names...
Like the car.  He hangs out with Skank. that little ass-hair, and they hang at the Pit -- hell, Funboy lives there.  Ask Top Dollar.
T-Bird?
You want those assholes, you want Top Dollar.
Another jolly nickname?
Top Dollar.
Wrong answer.
I ain't got no fuckin' ring.
Cute nickname, don't you think?
I took yours from you.  Your little girlfriend?  I took hers, too.  Your meaningless, petty life?  I took it so that tonight your existence might gain a purpose.  You're no avenger. You're mine.
And how many lives have you destroyed?
I don't believe that. Lao motions to Grange with the killing blade.  Grange RELAXES his deathgrip on the crow.  MOVE IN CLOSE on Eric so we may perceive a palpable degree of relief.
You're too late.  There was a guy outside - on the stairs - you really need to talk to.  But he turned to dust and blew away.  I don't have any power for you to take.
Sooner or later, my action were destined to bring me a genuine Fury.  And it turned out to be you. At last.  I appreciate your abilities as few mortals can. That's why I desire them.
I know.  That is why I will prevail.  Mr. Grange... ?
I want the girl.  Unharmed.  Now.
I wish to possess what you have now.
Of course you can. ANGLE - GRANGE IN THE GALLERY --  in darkness.  The running lights on his night-scoped, laser-sighted sniper's rifle which THROWS vague sprays of eerie red and green light.
I can see her.
I believe our friend Elly call you Mister Crow.  Please acknowledge; the mike will pick you up.
Your pain ends now.
No, wait, no WAIT, that's too much, man, that's like overkill, nobody can take that much, you're wasting it -- !
Does it hurt?!  You dead-ass, clown-faced fuck, of course it fucking hurts!  What the shit are you gonna do about this?!
Does it hurt?
Owwwaaaa -- fuck me!  Look what you did to my sheets, you lame piece'a shit!  AAAAaa!  Goddd!
Yeah, I got a more fun idea myself.
Neither.
Magic.
How the hell did you do that?
Very well, it's your ass.
Don't waste my time.
I'm already alone.
You'll be alone.
Fine with me.
Do this thing and you will be vulnerable.  The blood will not return.  No powers.  No reunion.  Nothing.
Tell me I'll get hurt.  That I might die.  I've already done that.  I don't need anyone's help.  Yours included.
Your job is done.  You interfere with the living again.
Maybe I was wrong about you.
Shut up.
You need to learn to mind your own business or you'll never get where you think you're going.
Go away.
Getting a little ambitious and extracurricular, aren't we?
You work for the dead.  Forget that, and you can forget it all.
Bugger off to the graveyard, skull- face, I'm busy.
Glad to see you're finally with the program.
Leave me alone -- !
Get it?
Kill the men who killed you both, and the Day of the Dead will be your reunion.
Yes.
Miss her?
Shelly?
Having fun yet?  No?  I'll give you a hint.  Remember whatshername?
Interested?  Follow the crow.
What the hell are you?
Yeah, I know, fatso.  Do us all a favor.  Make Top Dollar smile.
What's this -- a little, ah, bloodstain, right?  Fifty bucks for the box, and I'm doin' you a --
Leather purse...
Nineteen bucks at Sears.  Fake,
...necklace... pearls...
18k.  Crap.
Coupla more rings... 24k.
Whoa, hey, whoa.  Business.
Blow yourself, bigmouth.
Move in, guys.
No shooting.
I've got him if you want him.
Is he inside?
We've got company.
Kill a dead guy?
Who is only invulnerable so long as he cares about the dead.  When he begins to care about the living, you'll find his heart can bleed... and I want it to bleed for me.
Only thing you'll get from that clown is a faster way to die. LAO To the contrary...
Mmm.  But tonight I can take what is his.
Like some sort of zombie on a revenge trip.
Do you know of spirit assassins? You do know the dead can rise? Properly motivated, of course.
Not a Plymouth Fury, I bet.
I intend no slight to you, but I cannot find the English to adequately express just what he is.  I suppose Western mythology would describe him as a Fury.
Give me a break.  That guy's a wacko...
Extremely so.  You and I are the recipients of unwanted good fortune, in the form of a man everyone is calling The Crow.
That thing is poisonous.
This is a cobra, Mr. Grange.  Yes, it is real.

I know -- and you could show me the door. You would, too, if you weren't still hoping the guests might arrive.
You know that you're in my house.
Lying to you -- Why should I?
You're lying.
I didn't.
I see why you're here -- you knew that nobody was coming.
He lied to me again.
That's my business. -- Now, it's all right, Daniel.  What did he do?
Thank you, Belle --
Belle --
No, thank you -- what's your name?
You're not resting well, are you? I know -- it's that music.  You need your sleep. Is there anything else you want?
I've brought you something to keep you warm, Mrs. Stone --
Jabez -- ?
No, siree, it didn't. And it won't -- no matter what happens -- just as long as the folks at the fair believe in freedom and Union. So --  Giddyap, Constitution -- and let's keep going, Mr. Stone.
But it didn't stop. I know it didn't stop. Granny told me it didn't.

You're wrong, Mr. Stone. There are people who live and die without e'er seeing it. They can't see the country for the money in their pockets -- And some think their state's the country, or the way they live is the country, and they're willing to split the country because of that. Well, I hope you'll meet all those, when you're grown. You'll meet the fire-eaters and the Circassian beauties -- that's part of the fair, to be sure. But if we'd had to depend on them, in a permanent way, the country would have stopped at the Allegheny mountains.
Anybody can see that.

Well -- it's high and it's wide and it goes a long way and there is a wind blowing through it and a blue roof over it -- it's the hills up here and the rivers running south and the new States growing in the West.
What's that, sir?
Maybe you can, sometime, Daniel. I'm a farmer, you know, and like to show my farm -- but the thing I'd like to show you most, you'll have to see for yourself.
Golly -- I'd like to see all your horses!

No, Daniel -- they are not race horses. They are good old friends of mine. I call 'em Constitution and Bill of Rights, the most dependable pair for long journeys. I've got one called Missouri Compromise, too, and then there's a Supreme Court -- fine, dignified horse, though you do have to push him now and then.
Make them go faster, Mr.... ?
It does hurt! And don't you do it again.
Why? It don't hurt.
Daniel! Don't ever let me catch you doing that again!
And serve him right!
Well, I thought he'd come in the middle.
And what about Daniel Webster?
I think I'd like to begin with the fire-eater --
A varied list of attractions. And which would you like to see first, Dan'l?
'N Daniel Webster will be there.
Young man -- you got me there.
And two unpara-- unparalleled Cir-cass-ian beauties? What is that?
Guess there will, if it says so.
No -- but I can hardly wait -- Mister -- tell me, will there really be --  -- a man that eats fire?
It hasn't opened yet?
Gee -- that Fair --
All right, Daniel. Jump in.
Well, I wouldn't mind.  But my name's Daniel Stone.
Hello, Colonel! Want a lift?
All right, darling.
I don't want to be up there all alone, Mama.... I want to be with you.
Daniel! ... You must go to sleep.
Mama!
No, no, I don't want to go to bed. I want to be here for the party.
Daniel, you ought to be in bed.
Daniel! ...  I've stood just about as much as I can bear!
No! No! I won't.
Daniel give me that beanshooter!
It's mine, Ma! Pa made it for me -- and I'm not going to give it to anyone!
Yes, you did, Daniel! I saw it from the window. And then to lie about it! Give me that beanshooter, Daniel!
Not me!
I see you! Riding pretty high, ain't you? Look out you don't fall off.
Grandma, look at me!
I did not, Grandma.
Lan's to goodness, what happened to that hen? Did you use that beanshooter again?
That's just too bad --
But I like the new one better.
Move? -- We are not going to move -- the old one is good enough for us.
Granny, when do we move to the new house?

Now don't you worry about that. You just leave it all to me. We won't talk business now ... just bear this in mind ... I'm not the man to get rich on other people's hard luck.... No, sir... not me! ...
Say ... about the interest ...
Thanks, Jabez -- I really wouldn't need very much ... if you could let me have some seed to start off with enough for spring planting ...
Not at all, Hank ... not at all. Glad to help you.
Don't I? ... Say, that's mighty white of you, Jabez.
Oh -- you don't have to go to Miser Stevens while I'm around.
Yes, but what does a farmer do if he don't want to get roped in some more by them loan sharks?
I don't know -- don't seem much of an idea to me.
Well -- here's how it is ...Tom Sharp, Eli Higgins and a couple of others been talking to me about -- that new sort of organization -- grange they call it. What you think about it?

Kin you spare a moment for me Jabez?
Howdy, Hank.
Howdy, Jabez.
We'll be mighty glad to have you with us.

Jabez -- will you join our Grange now?
I'll look out for myself! ... Now go away -- leave me alone.
Well -- we don't mean to force you, Jabez Stone -- but -- it's only for your own good.

Black Dan'l?

Sure does. But I'll have to sleep on it a couple of nights.
Yes, it's the debt and the lien and the mortgage that eats up the farmer!
Sure am.
Are you one of old Stevens' customers too?
Too bad it didn't happen to Miser Stevens.
Loan shark -- hey?
Belle --
Belle.
Never mind. What's your name?
But she is -- I've taken her place. Don't you remember -- you wrote me a letter. Mrs. Stone was too ill.
She couldn't be gone!
No. She's gone.
You're not -- Dorothy.
Stevens -- what's all this leading up to? You know something. Come on! Out with it -- you know something about me!
I do -- and I think you should too.
Huh? -- What's that?  Well -- what about it? Who cares, anyhow?

All right -- so it's buried with you!
Don't say that -- I know it is --

But what becomes of our souls?

-- of what happens after we die!

You are afraid!
What's the matter with you?
Well -- it seems to me -- I remember when you paid me--
Almost seven.  No -- no, he's not seven yet I am sure --

Mornin', Jabez ...

Real! Sheriff, you are a witness that this money is paid me voluntarily, and while it does not satisfy the mortgage, it has become my property.
You know -- some folks are just lucky. Others pick gold right out of the air.  Like that!
I'd like to know where you'd get it....
-- in gold.
No, Stone!
I barely managed to scrape up a bit for you. I thought if I made a kind of part payment --
Well, Stone -- have you got the money?
Stevens!
Gentlemen, the prosecution rests.
You know darn well it is.
But, Mr. Stone, I am hardly to blame for the pricking of your wholly unnecessary conscience.  Is this your signature?
Yes -- yes, I am the richest man -- too rich. I can't think of anything but money. That's the trouble with me.
That is highly irrelevant to this case, Your Honor.
Yes, I did -- but you tricked me into signing it! You told me my soul was nothing ... that I could forget all about a soul, in exchange for money. That was a lie, a lie, a lie.
Jabez Stone -- did you or did you not sign this document?
Never!

Well, why should that worry you. A soul -- a soul is nothing. Can you see it, smell it, touch it? -- No! -- Think of it -- this soul -- your soul -- a nothing, against seven whole years of good luck! That's right, Mr. Stone -- there is --  -- just one little formality. I'd like your signature here -- see. And when it's done -- it's done for seven years.  It's our usual form. Of course -- we may be able to take up the question of a renewal in due time.
It's mine?

Yes, why shouldn't it?

A clever man like yourself -- he can find money anywhere. Money to pay his bills -- money for his wife and his children -- money to be a rich man. All he needs is a friend to point it out to him.  Like that!
Well, now, Mister, that sounds all right. But--

Of course. Why man, you have one of the richest farms in the county.  You just go about it the wrong way -- so many men do. Hard work -- well, that's all right for people who don't know how to do anything else. It's all right for people who aren't lucky -- but once you're lucky -- you don't work for other people. You make them work for you.
Opportunities?
You've had a lot of bad luck these days. And yet -- it's all so unnecessary. When I think of your opportunities --
You can't say that to me! I'm New Hampshire. If I say I called you, I did.  I guess I did.
Do you deny that you called me? I've known people in other States who went back on their word. But I didn't expect it in New Hampshire.
Breakfast ... Ah! ... Come along friends, Ma Stone's a cook this side of heaven.
Ma says breakfast's ready, Mr. Webster!
I know -- that was mighty queer Medford -- knew it the minute I tasted it. But it takes more than that to down Daniel Webster.
Well, I --
You were worried, Jabez, weren't you?
Oh, come, man, come. Just because you've sold your soul to the devil that needn't make you a teetotaler.
There's no joy in it for me.
There's nothing like it. I saw an inchworm take a drop of it once, and he stood right up on his hind legs and bit a bee. Come -- try a nip!

Not long -- now.
They make plucky women in New England.  H'm ... how long have we to wait?
Yes -- at midnight.
I see. And this is where he'd like to collect, too.

It's your fault! You brought Daniel Webster here -- just to try to make a fool of me! You played the sneak behind my back -- made up all sorts of lies against me! You can get yourself out of my home -- go back to the other house -- that old place, where you belong -- I don't want to -- to talk to you again!
No -- you haven't time -- You haven't time for your mother, or your wife, or your child.
I -- I don't know what you're talking about! I -- I haven't time to listen to all this --

I'm sorry you can't see that, I know you could once -- you made a little speech once, that I'll always remember and I know the others do too --  They remember and they see how you have changed. That's why they didn't want to come tonight to you, Jabez -- you're as blind as a Burma bat, with your gold pot! Mind you, it's not the money, I've been talking about, it's what you make of it.
They'd have a good neighbor, Jabez -- and that's worth much more than anything else -- much, much more!
Contracts? -- Yes, they have contracts with me -- lots of 'em -- but -- but that's all right. Without me and my money, they wouldn't have anything.
You, Jabez Stone -- you and a lot of poor farmers, hereabouts -- good men of the earth who are in trouble because of you. Or -- am I wrong about those contracts, Mr. Stone?
What -- what's on your mind?

That's just fine, Neighbor Stone -- but -- I have to be pretty careful of my seats of honor -- where I sit, I mean. You see, the whole country sort of has its eye on me, Jabez -- anybody in public life has that difficulty -- even you, Jabez. They watch us carefully, our neighbors and our enemies, and they see much more than we think they do -- and understand much more. My friends all like to think that I've got the good of mankind always at heart, and I've got to make sure that those I deal with have the good of mankind always at heart, too. Do you know what I'm talking about, Jabez?
Well -- Mr. Webster! This is a great day for me. Come on in, sir. I want you to take the seat of honor and meet all my guests!
Well -- I'll be -- if it isn't little Mary Sampson from Franklin.
Mr. Webster -- I'd like you to meet my wife, Mary.
Eloquent speech, Neighbor Stone -- couldn't have done better myself --  -- under the circumstances.  Thank you.
Thanks, Mr. Webster!  To the champion of the whole United States -- Dan'l Webster!
Here's a man who knows what's good for Dan'l Webster! Medford rum! Ah, a breath of the Promised Land!  To the champion of the Iron Horseshoe, Jabez Stone!
Not at all, lad -- not at all.  For a good game of horseshoes I would always sacrifice fame and acclaim.
Seems like it's my fault, Mr. Webster.
I don't seem to be so very popular after all -- in Cross Corners.
Thank you, Mr. Webster.
You win. Will you ride to the village with me, Mr. Stone?
Ten throws it is.
Ten throws -- Mr. Webster?
Shake!
5000 -- that's just what I owe you.
How much?
Why not -- ?
Oh yes -- I am -- want to bet?
You are not so sure that he'll come.
That's fine. Now you can tell people all about the house, but don't mention Webster.
Well -- yes --
Now, Squire, you're not going to let me down. We still want to do a lot of business together, don't we?
You mean that's all you had me come out here for?
Yes  siree -- that's the idea. Get them all here and then say: "Look, folks -- here's Daniel Webster, my guest of honor." Golly, I can see their eyes pop already.
You want me to go around --
You keep that -- that's for you. I want you to talk up the party to make sure that the best folks really come.
You think that's a joke? I had him on there too, but I was afraid Dan'l Webster might feel insulted.

Yes -- and that's the reason I wanted to talk with you. You got my invitation?

Why of course --

Well, Jabez -- I'm a little pressed for time. You wanted to discuss something -- some business --
You really think so?
How do you do, Belle? How are you, Jabez?  Well -- mighty elegant house you got here.

Well? Don't a politician have to be?
But -- I was just lucky.
Selectman? Selectman of the village? Me?
And so, Jabez Stone, in the name of the Whig Party of Cross Corners, we offer you the nomination of that party for Selectman.
Camomile tea!
Worst I had in years -- ahem -- starting a spring cold, I guess -- er -- don't happen to have a bit of camomile tea in the house, do you, Stone?
Headache -- Squire?
Oh!
Ahem -- Neighbor Stone, we want--

Come right into the parlor, won't you, folks.
Ahem -- we want to have a little confidential talk with you, Neighbor Stone. Don't like to take a man away from his planting -- but sometimes --
Morning, Jabez.
Why -- good morning, Squire.
Shall we?
Coming along, Jabez?
Mary!
Jabez -- Jabez!
All right, Jabez ...

Oh, Jabez! ...  Did you hear, Mr. Webster? --  Now you'll help him, won't you?

Well -- I -- I-

Mary --
Mary -- but look -- it didn't touch an ear of my corn -- we'll have a rich harvest.
Ruined -- all the fields -- ruined.

Jabez -- once you said we'd never change --

Worried!

Mary -- what would you do?
Jabez!

Not all of it?

Do you think I'm grudging it?
Your butter money?

... just remember that, cause I'll be back ...

Well, I do trust him.  Lando's an old friend.  Must have been an accident.
Something's wrong here.  Your friend Lando is very charming, but I don't trust him.
He found him in a junk pile ...
Luke!  I'm sure he's fine.  Probably sitting around wondering what we're doing right now.
I hope Luke made it to the fleet all right.
Huh?  Oh.  Your droid's been gone too long just to be lost.  He may have gotten into some trouble. Chewie went to look for him.  Come over here.  I want to check this out.
Has Threepio turned up yet?
You look great.
You look silly.
Who's staring?
What are you staring at?
It'll be all right.  Trust me.  And keep your eyes open.  You wait here.
I don't like this.
Let er go, Chewie.
You do have your moments ... Not many, but you do have them.
No.  But he has no love for the Empire, that much I know ...
Can you trust him?
A Tibanna gas mine.  Lando won it in a sabacc match, or so he claims. Lando and I go way back.
A mining colony.
Lando's not a system, he's a man. A gambler, con-artist ... all- around scoundrel ...  ... your kind of guy.  The system is called Bespin.  It's a ways from here, but reachable.
Never heard of that system.
Well, sometimes ... Ah-hah, I knew it!  Lando Calrissian.
You keep logs?  My, how organized.
