Here ... near the Anoat system.
That depends.  Where are we?
Then we have to find a safe port around here.  Got any ideas?
Not bad, hot shot, not bad.  Then what?
The fleet is finally breaking up. I'm hoping they'll follow standard Imperial procedure and dump their garbage before they go into light speed.
What'd you have in mind for your next move?
Chewie, check the manual release on the landing claws.
I'm still not sure what you've accomplished.
Oh, so sorry!  Didn't mean to offend your droid.  You think braking and shutting down in that amount of time is easy?
You could have warned him before you shut him off.
You're going to attack them?!!!
Sharp bank, Chewie.  Let's turn this bucket around.  You heard me, turn around!  Full power on the front shield.
It's not my fault.  I can't under- stand it!
No lightspeed?
Couldn't be, I checked the transfer circuits, just like you said!  I tell you this time it's not my fault.  I'm sure I checked it.
The entrance is collapsing!
I see it Chewie, hang on.
But the tremors have stopped.
Strap yourself in, sweetheart, we're taking off!
Those Star Destroyers will spot us long before you can get into light speed.  You can't make the jump in this asteroid field.
There will be more of them.  They always travel in groups.  And there's nothing they like better than to attach themselves to ships. Just what we need right now.
Looks like some kind of Mynock.
Look, we just got this bucket going again.  I'm not about to let some varmint tear it apart ...
Are you crazy!
Outside, in the cave.
Where?
There's something out there!
Try and control this ...
I do not!
You mean a man you can control.
There's nothing dull about a man I can depend on to be civilized.
Sure, they're safer.  You always know what they're going to do. Trouble is, it gets a little dull.
Don't count on it.  I happen to like nice men.
Afraid of?  Certainly not you Captain Solo ... or any other man in this galaxy.
What are you afraid of?
Why?
Stop that.
That's quite a compliment.
Sometimes, maybe ... occasionally, when you aren't acting like a scoundrel.
You could be a touch warmer, though.  Admit it, against your better judgment you think I'm all right.
Yes, you do.
Sure.  I guess I make it difficult sometimes.
Would you please stop calling me that?
Easy, your worship.  Only trying to help.
Where have I heard that before?
They're just trying to see if they can stir something up ... we're safe.
They're moving away.
Felt like a hydro concussion ... an Imperial Cruiser.
That was no earthquake.
Fine with me.  But I'm afraid you'll have to let go.
I don't expect anything, except to be left alone.
Well, I hope you don't expect more.
Sorry, Captain, being held by you isn't enough to get me excited.
Beautiful.
How do I look?
You don't look angry.
Very funny.  You can let go now .... I'm getting angry.
Why, Princess, this is so sudden.
That should do nicely.
What is it?
There, there.  Chewie get a reading on that.  Looks pretty good.
Right.  I'm going to get in closer to one of these big ones ...
Now you're making sense.
We've got to get out of this shower.
I'm against that.
But we're going to get pulverized if we stay out here much longer.
Good.
That Star Destroyer is slowing down.
I take it back.
Well, you said you wanted to be there when I was wrong.
Aren't I?  Hang on, sweetheart. We're gonna do some flyin'.
To get killed ... you're not seriously going into an asteroid field?
Let's hope so ... it's just the chance we need.
Probably an asteroid field ....
Asteroids!  Chewie, bank left, let's find out where they're coming from ...
Or you ran into something ....
That was no laser blast .... some- thing hit us ....
I'm glad you said there was going to be no problem, or I'd be worried.
Two more Star Destroyers heading right at us.
I know, I know, I see them ... LEIA See what?
I'll be surprised if we ever start moving.
This baby's got a few surprises left in her.
This bucket of bolts is never going to get us past that blockade.
Don't worry, your holiness, I'll get her started.
Would it help if I got out and pushed?
Wait, don't open it ... that's one of the traps for the ice creatures.
Hey!  Someone's still in here.
Who's scruffy-looking?  I tell ya' sweetheart, I must've hit pretty close to the mark to get you hoppin' like this.  Doesn't it look that way to you, Luke?
Why you low-down, stuck-up, half- witted, scruffy-looking nerf-herder.
Come on, your highness, are you telling me you haven't been thinking about that kiss?
You must have gone completely out of your feeble mind.
Ooops!  I guess you haven't told Luke about that yet.
I don't know what he's talking about.
I had nothing to do with it.  General Rieekan thinks it's dangerous for any ships to leave the system until we know where that probe came from.
Well, your worship, it looks like you arranged to keep me close by for a while longer.
Now don't panic.  We don't know that.
An Imperial probe droid.
Droid of some kind.  I didn't hit it that hard.  It must have had a self-destruct ....
What was it?
.... I'm afraid there's not much left.
No kidding.  If this snowball's got nasty natives, they could be anywhere.
Now all we've got to worry about is what attacked him.
Forget it.
Those creatures he keeps talking about ... we'd better double the security ... Han, I don't know how ...
Sure ... If I were interested. But I don't think it'd be much fun.
And you think you're the one to apply some heat?
Spare me please!  Don't tell me about the Rebellion again.  I've had it with your noble mission. All you let yourself think about is the Rebellion.  The result is you're as cold as this planet.
We are fighting for a cause much ...

There's no accounting for taste. Believe me, you could use a good kiss.  You've spent so much time doing your duty and giving orders you've never learned how to be a woman. It's a shame, because you've got all the makings for one.  I could have helped you plenty in that department ... if you'd have let go for a minute.  But it's too late now, sweetheart.  Your big opportunity is flying out of here.
I'd just as soon kiss a wookiee.
Am I?  I say you came running after me because you were afraid I was leaving you without even a kiss.
I respect you.  You're a bold fighter, maybe not the brightest, but ... HAN No, your worship.. That's not what I'm talking about.
You want me to stay because of the way you feel about me.
And what are they, pray tell?
You probably don't.  How could you?  You're so terrified of your own emotions ...
Me?  I don't know what you mean.
Not you?
Yes.
We?
Han, we need you here.

He'll know when he gets back ... Don't give me that look.  Every day more bounty hunters are searching for me.  If I don't pay off Jabba soon, there'll be too many to stop ... Remotes, Gank killers, and who knows what else.  I've got to get that price off my head while I still have a head.
Does Luke know?
That bounty hunter we ran into on Ord Mantell changed my mind.
You said you were going to stay. What happened?
Yes, Your Highness?
Don't worry.  You haven't seen the last of us.
I hope you make your peace with Jabba.
Now don't get the wrong idea, pal. She was just trying to express her true feelings for me.
About what?
That makes a good story.  But I think you just can't bear to let me out of your sight.
Probe?  What probe?
That's two you owe me, junior.
Thanks to you.
Hi kid, you look strong enough to wrestle a Gundark.
I'll see you shortly. A meteorite just hit the ground near here and I want to check it out .. Won't be long.
There isn't enough life on this ice cube to fill a space cruiser. My sentry markers are placed. I'm heading back to the base.
I've finished my circle and I haven't picked up any life read- ings.
Loud and clear, kid.  What's up?
Yeah, you're a real hero.
Don't shoot!  I've done what I can for you.  I'm sorry it's not better, but I've got my own problems.  I've already stuck my neck out further than I should ...
Don't ask me, but he's on his way.
All this just to get the kid? What's so important about him?
Luke?  I don't get it.
He doesn't want you at all.  He's after someone named Skywalker.
You don't know much about much if you think Vader won't want us dead before this is over.
Vader agreed to turn Leia and Chewie over to me.  They'll have to stay here, but at least they'll be safe.
This ought to be good.
Shut up a minute and listen.  I'm doing what I can to make this easier for you.
Get out of here, Lando!
I'm sorry too.
Sorry friend, I had no choice. They arrived right before you did.
Nothing.  I never would have guessed that underneath that wild schemer I knew was a respon- sible leader and businessman ... But you wear it well.
Not as well as I'd like.  We're a small outpost and not very self- sufficient.  I've had supply problems of every kind and ...  What's so funny?
How's your mining operation going?
I'll have my people get to work on it right away.  Hate the thought of the Millennium Falcon without her heart.
Hyperdrive.
That ship saved my life a few times.  It's the fastest hunk of machinery in the galaxy.  What's wrong with her?
What have you done to my ship?
Repairs ...
That won't be easy, my friend ... What brings you here, anyway?
I'll bet.
I always said you were a gentleman.
Are you kidding?
No hard feelings?
Why you slimy, double-crossing no-good swindler ... am I glad to see you.
I'm altering the bargain.  Pray I don't alter it any further.
That wasn't the bargain.  You said the Empire wouldn't interfere in--
Take them, but I'm keeping a detachment of troops here to watch over them.
I'll take what's mine now.
I think not.  But I don't wish my prize to be damaged.  We'll test it first.  Bring in Captain Solo.
We only use this chamber for carbon freezing.  If you put him in there, it'll kill him.
Good.  It would be most unfortunate if I had to leave a permanent garrison here.
No.
I forget nothing, Calrissian. Perhaps you think you're being treated unfairly.
That was never mentioned.  Neither was this bounty hunter taking Han. I hope you haven't forgotten our bargain.
You will find them well enough. But they must never again leave this city.
What about Leia and the Wookiee?
That sounds familiar.
I'm sure my men fixed it.  We've got nothing to worry about.
Are the coordinates set?
The deflector shields are gone.
It's Luke.  Get under him.  Slow down.  Easy Chewie.  Line up your tracking system.  Lando, open the hatch.
Someone's falling.
Wait a minute.  We're not going back there.
No argument, just do it.  That's a command!
Luke needs help.  We must go back.
What?
Luke!
I knew that set-up was too good to last .... I'm going to miss it.
I didn't say anything?
What'd you say?
His fate is sealed.  You'll be lucky to get out yourself.  All systems are on alert.  everything's locked.
We've got to find Luke.
Don't worry about a thing.  I'll get us going.
You'd better know what you're doing, or this is going to get very messy.
What chance have we got in here? What are we going to do when they cut ...
Sure I did ... once.  It turned out lousy.
You've probably never done an honorable thing in your life.
Very noble.  Not smart, but noble.
There's not much chance, but the bounty hunter's ship is on the East Landing Platform.
Chewie's right.  We must try to save Han.
This is no time to be choosy, honey.  What do you say we debate this later?  There's still a chance I can get you out of here.
We have no use for your kind.
Look, I stand to lose everything by this.
And when do you betray us again?
I'm coming over to your side, that's what.  And I have a feeling I'm making a big mistake.
What's going on?
... we're the bait.
Lord Vader has set a trap for him and ...
I didn't know you had a price on your head.  Vader has given you to the bounty hunter.
What about Han?
Yes, we keep pollution down by having the power reactor far below the city.  It's connected by a transfer shaft.
It's a lovely outpost.
Not actually .... Our operation is small enough not to be noticed, so you might say we're enterprisers. Most of our trade is, well ... unofficial.
You're part of the mining guild then?
.... We are a free station and do not fall under the jurisdiction of the Empire.
Would you care to join me for a little refreshment?
Thanks.
I must say, your beauty is unpar- alleled.  Truly you belong here with us among the clouds.
Not really.
Sorry, am I interrupting anything?
You may call me Leia.
Hello!  What have we here?  Welcome, I am Baron Lando Calrissian, Administrator of this facility ... and who might you be?
We have no choice.  Send them up ... and start clearing everyone out.
Two transports at a time is awfully risky.
What is it?
We've picked up something outside the base in zone one, moving East.
Not yet.  They're working on it now.
Have they analyzed the one that was killed?
Slim, but yes, there's a chance. They have a shelter.  It's not much, but ...
Is there any chance of them surviving out there?
The speeders should be ready in the morning.  They'll make the search easier.
I understand.
Nothing more can be done tonight. The shield doors must be closed. I can't wait any longer.  I'm sorry.
Let's go.
Artoo, you did it!  I never doubted you for a second ...
I thought you knew this person.
Rather touchy, aren't they.
Well, what now?
Sir, we've lost the rear deflector shield.  One more direct hit on the back quarter and we're done for.
Oh my, no!
What??
Sir, it's very possible this asteroid is not stable.
A tremor!
Closer?!
Closer?!
If I might remind you, sir, the probability of successfully navi- gating through an asteroid field is approximately 365,000 to one ... a graceful surrender might not be ...
You don't have to do this to impress me.
I'll be back later.
So much has happened during the period of your indisposition, sir.
You rest now.
I've never seen it fail.
This hyperdrive had better work.
He'll survive.
Lando, is he alright? ... Lando? Are you there?  How's Luke?
Luke, no!  It's a trap.
Leia!
Snow creatures ... they're here?!
I could get more loyalty if I went down the hall and recruited some of those snow creatures.
Jabba the Hutt?
He wants to pay off that criminal he's in hock to.
Calm down, will ya?  Tell me about Han.
Han's leaving?
First Han, now you.  When am I going to learn not to count on anyone but myself? ...
What are you talking about?
That's just great.  Why doesn't everyone just take off?
I have this ... feeling.  I'm not sure, really ...
Where are you going?
What did you say?!
Leia ... What would you think if I went away for a while?
Me too.  I was afraid.
I'm fine.  Really.  Leia ... when I was out there and it looked pretty bad ... well, it made me think about things.
The Bacta are growing well.  The scars should be gone in a day or so.  Does it still hurt?
If it must be.  Yes.
And sacrifice Han and Leia?
I've learned so much since then.  And I'll return to finish ... I promise that, master.
Yes, yes.  To Obi-wan you listen young one.  The tree.  Remember your failure at the tree!  Heh?
Foreknowledge is helpful, but painful sometimes and dangerous too.  You have far to go in your training.
They're my friends.
Difficult to see.  Always in motion is the future ... Back away, little machine!
Will they die?
It is the future you see.
I see them! ... They're in pain ... they're suffering.
Bespin.  I see it too ... Friends you have there, heh?  Concentrate and see them you will.
I see a city in the clouds.
Control, control you must learn of what you see.  Not easy, not fast.
My mind fills with so many images.
Free your mind and return he will.
Ben?  Ben?
Only what you take with you.
What's in there?
This tree is strong with the dark side of The Force.  A servant of evil it is.  Into it you must go.
I feel cold.
Yes ... I also feel danger ... death.  Something's not right.
Four this time!  The Force you feel.
No!  Nothing more will I tell you now. Clear your mind of questions ... Quiet now be ... at peace ...
But tell me why ...
You will know.  When you are at peace ... calm ... passive.  A Jedi uses The Force for knowledge and defense.  Never for attack.
But how am I to know the good side from the dark?
No, no.  Easier, quicker, more seductive.
Lord Vader ... Is the dark side stronger?
The dark side beckons.  But if once start down the dark path, forever will it dominate your destiny.  Consume you it will ... as it did Obi-wan's apprentice.
Price?  What do you mean?
Anger, fear, aggression!  The dark side of The Force are they.  Easily they flow ... quick to join you in a fight.  Beware, beware, beware of them.  A heavy price is paid for the power they bring.
But I feel The Force flowing!
No, no.  This will not do.  Anger is what you feel.
That would matter not were The Force flowing through you.  Higher you'd jump!  Faster you'd move! Open yourself to The Force you must.
They're a lot stronger than I'm used to.
That they are.
I thought those seekers were set for stun!
Concentration.  Heh?  Concentration.
That is why you fail.
I don't believe it.
Size has no meaning.  It matters not.  Look at me.  Judge me by my size do you?
I can't. It's too big.
No.  Try not.  Do, do.  Or do not. There is no try.
Okay.  I'll give it a try.
No!  No different!  The differences are in your mind.  Throw them out! No longer of use are they to you.
Master, moving rocks is one thing, but this is a little different.
Yes, but by what standard, ask I?  Forget your old measures. Unlearn, heh, unlearn.
I thought I was in good shape.
It would be in seven pieces, were you a Jedi.
You will be, my young one.  Heh. You will be.
I will not fail you.  I'm not afraid.
You are reckless!
I have followed my feelings.
To become a Jedi takes the deepest commitment, the most serious mind.
Why not me?
Ready are you?  What know you of ready?  I have trained Jedi for 800 years.  My own counsel I'll keep on who is to be trained.
Never.

There is no escape.  You must join me or die.  Don't make me destroy you here ... The Emperor is strong with The Force.  But if you join me, together we could overthrow Him.  Do not resist. It is our destiny!
No! .... Never ....
The Force runs strong in the Skywalker line.  You will achieve great power ... Come, join with me!  Together we will be the most powerful ... even stronger than The Emperor.
Time will tell.
All too easy.  Perhaps you are not as strong as The Emperor thought.
That won't be necessary.
I'll die first.
There is much Obi-wan did not tell you.  Come, The Emperor will complete your training.
No!
Your future lies with us, Skywalker. Now you will embrace the dark side. Obi-wan knew this to be true.
And I too.
You'll find I'm full of surprises.
The fear does not reach you.  You have learned more than I anticipated.
I want that ship.
It won't get through the blockade.
Anything on the Millennium Falcon?
Seventeen ships destroyed, we don't know how many got away.
Make ready to land General Veers' assault troops on the surface. Then deploy the fleet so that nothing can get off that system. You're in command now, Admiral Piett.
Yes, My Lord.
Yes, Sir .... we have visuals ... the System is supposed to be devoid of human forms ...
The Hoth System?
--By itself it is only a piece of steel. Its power comes from he who wields it. For now there is no one. Do as I have ordered!
My King, I couldn't do it. Excalibur cannot be lost. Other men--
...I saw nothing.
When you threw it in, what did you see?
--Take Excalibur. Find a pool of calm water and throw the sword into it.
I cannot--
There is one thing left to do... Excalibur... And you must do it, Perceval. Leave my wounds, I command you.
...Perceval!
In the name of God, of St. Michael, and St. George, I make you a knight. Rise, Sir...
He heard Lady Guenevere's request and he said nothing. That is all.
Is he coming?
--It is the old wound, that has been opened. I have always known it would be the gateway to my death, for it has never healed. Let my heart do its job, my King, and pump me empty...
You are that and much more. You are its greatest knight, you are what is best in men. Now we will be together--
My salvation is to die a Knight of the Round Table.
Lancelot, I will save you... Don't die.
Arthur.
It is deep...
Hasn't Merlin mended your wound?
But one can still keep a sword sharp riding out in the name of the King's law.
They miss the battlefield. I think we do too.
Only give me leave to ride out again, to do what I am most able to do, and happiest doing.
Your deeds set an example for all other knights. For your gift, ask a gift of me.
I do. Rise, Lancelot, come with me.
These men repented before God for their evil deeds. Those who would not, met their fate at the end of my sword.  Accept the fruit of my first quest as my wedding gift.
We spared the lives of a few, so they could sail home and tell their fellows what fate they met at the hands of King Arthur's knights...
Lancelot, how did you fare in the North?
And a great heart it is. Sir Lancelot, you will be my champion.
My domain is here, inside this metal skin. And I would pledge to you all that I still own: muscle, bone, blood and the heart that pumps it.
I gave up my castles and my lands!
But your life and lands are far from here.
Then make me your champion and I will always fight in your place.
You are still the best knight in Christiandom. You gained a hundred advantages over me. It is I who must love you, for through your courage and patience you taught me a bitter lesson.
I, the best knight in the world, bested! This is a great day, for my search is over. I love you, my King.
Thanks to God, you are alive.
It is you, sir, who knows not the virtue of humility, as a true king must.
So be it, to the death.
Sir, your rage has unbalanced you. It seems you would fight to the death against a knight who is not your enemy, for a length of road you can ride around.
I sought only not to harm you, sir.
Fight me from your horse or on foot, but fight me. Your avoidance mocks me.
I will not.
Yield. I have the advantage.
I will not. You must retreat or prove your kingship in the test of arms, under the eyes of God.
Move aside!
Not a boast, sir, but a curse.  Never have I met my match in joust or duel.
--That is a wild boast. You lack a knight's humility.
I am Sir Lancelot of the Lake, from across the sea. I am the best knight in the whole of Christiandom, and I look for the king who is worthy of my sword's service.
I am King, and this is Excalibur, sword of kings from the dawn of time. Who are you, and why do you block the way?
I await the King himself. His knights are in need of training.
Move aside. This is the King's road, and the knights you joined arms against were his very own.
Good day to you, sir.
Lancelot?... It is Lancelot!
He can be no other.
I dreamed of him too... Merlin lives! He lives in our dreams now, in that dark and shadowy place that is as strong and real as this more solid one. He speaks to us from there.
Yes. He spoke to me. He said I would fight bravely tomorrow. I have never dreamed of Merlin before.
Of Merlin?
Merlin, will I live...?  ...I was dreaming...

Ready my knights for battle; they will ride with their King once more. I have lived through others far too long! Lancelot carried my honor and Guenevere my guilt. My knights have fought my causes. Mordred carries my sins. Now, at last, I will rule.
Perceval, you have returned!

...Gawain and Perceval, Bors and Bohort, Caradoc and Ector, and all the others--lost to me. Only the echo of their voices remains in this empty hall. All I have left is the memory of their fellowship. Echoes and memories. I am a ghost of the King that once was...  ...Mordred is real, alive, my own flesh and blood. I will see him, I must.
Don't recognize him. You were trapped by Morgana's sorcery.
At last...
Is this a dream? Tell me, Merlin!
--Stories... You brought me back. Your love brought me back. Back to where you are now, in the land of dreams...
Where have you been these many years? Is it true that Morgana--
But, I'm here.

It is like a tree. The roots of the stones spread out across the land and they draw on the thoughts and actions of men. Like sap those human matters course through the stones feeding the stars that are the leaves of the tree. And the stars whisper back to men the future course of events.  But the earth is being torn apart, its metals stolen, and the balance is broken and the lines of power no longer converge. In fact, I nearly didn't make it in one piece.
What is this place, Merlin?
I know. I have heard noises and echoes through the stones...
Quiet. You'll wake the men, and they must fight tomorrow for their very lives.
I cannot. I must not. Here I must stay.
I must do it myself. I must kill them both. Lancelot and Guenevere. Will you ride with me, Merlin?
You betray the boy who drew the sword, the boy who saw the Dragon... the Dragon who moves close by, coiling and uncoiling, restless, looking down, waiting for the King to be a king...
Me? I have lived by the oath of king and knight.
My powers fade, Arthur. I resort to cheap tricks...  Yes! I enjoy every moment of my foolishness, I join in the making of it, so no one can betray me. But you! You betray yourself.
With all your powers, you are content to be ridiculed, laughed at...
That is my destiny. I have a destiny, too...

I am alone and betrayed. By my wife, by my beloved friend, by my knights. And by you. Perhaps most of all by you. For you made me, you forged this wretched life. And like a child tired of a toy, you toss me aside, a babbling lecher trotting after my sister...
I didn't ask for poetry. Which is it?
What?  The greatest? They blend together like the metals we mix to make a good sword.

A king should be afraid, always. The enemy is everywhere. Waiting in ambush in the dark corridors of his castle, on the deer paths of his forest, or in the gray and winding paths of a more tangled forest, in here.
Just yes? No mad laughter, no riddles, nothing but a simple yes? That frightens me.
Yes.
What is it my child?
Merlin, tell me. Now that Guenevere is returned to me...
Never where you expect it, that's all I know.
Where hides evil, then, in my kingdom?
Good and evil; there is never one without the other.

Then answer me this. For years peace has reigned in the land. Crops grow in abundance, there is no want. Every one of my subjects enjoys his portion of happiness and justice, even those whose tiresome misunderstandings we must resolve here each day. Tell me, Merlin: have we defeated evil, as it seems?
At your service, sir.
...to ride out and meet them.
The knights of Galys approach the camp. It would be politic...
The Lady of the Lake. Take it. Take it, quickly!
Excalibur! Is it true?
You know full well there is, and I go to meet it now. Come witness my revenge.
Come now. So much anger for such a little crime? Are you sure there is nothing else troubling you?
So you were stealing their honey. They should have killed you.
I had to weave a little enchantment on the bees so I could get some honey, and I didn't feel up to using any more magic just yet. Anyway, I was in less danger than you'll be in today.
I should have left you to fend for yourself.
You're not listening. Your heart is not. Love is deaf as well as blind.
Guenevere...
Guenevere. And a beloved friend who will betray you.
Who will it be? Put your mind to it, then.

There are maidens as fair, and fairer than Guenevere. If I put my mind to it, I could see them now, many of them, weeping for love of you, watching the hills for you coming from the high towers of their castles. Offering you their every favor. Rich, clever--but if it is to be Guenevere, so be it.
I love her. If she would be my queen, my dreams would be answered.
...of course...
A king must marry, after all.
What's this, what's this?!
Then as knight to knight I can offer you mercy.
The dragon! There...
What?!

The book without pages. Open before you, all around us. You can see it in bits and pieces, for if mortal men were to see it whole and all complete in a single glance, why, it would burn him to cinders.
What book is that?
In the great book.
How? Where?
Because you must! You and only you. Have you forgotten that it was you who freed Excalibur?
It's just that I have no experience, and no men to speak of. How can I--
Thank you.
I must find the means to save him, then. I was hoping I could ask you for a little magic help, but if it makes you so tired...
Well there. You don't need me half as much as you think you do. You already know what must not happen.
Yes, yes, I know that. Everybody does. Lord Leondegrance is my only ally among the barons and the great knights. I can't lose him.
It is whispered in the forest that...  ...Leondegrance's castle is under siege by Lot and Uryens.
'Help me, Help me.' Help me get up.
Merlin, help me. I need your help. I don't know how--
That's not why you came.
I want to thank you.
But not from your destiny.
You saved me from the arrow...
You are the son of King Uther, and the fair Igrayne... you are King Arthur.
Whose son am I?
Speak of the devil!...
Who is Merlin?
So be it.
I will muster a great force of knights, and I will return to fight for what is mine.
And I offer only this, Father. To commit with passion and pleasure all the evils that you failed to commit, as man and king.
I cannot offer you the land, only my love...
Your mother told you that?
The very spear that pierced the side of Christ as he died on the cross.

And you are the great King? The lords have rebelled. Invaders attack the coasts. Crops don't grow. There is nothing but plague and hunger in the land. Only I am feared. I will be king. You may have lost Excalibur, but I have found my own weapon of power. There.
I recognize you only as my son, no more.
I have come to claim what is mine, Father.
Rise, Mordred.
Father...
We fought and won battles, and now one man defeats all my knights? I will go.
He is the mightiest and fairest of knights.
I don't know. Merlin brought you to me when you were newly born and charged me to raise you as my own. At first, I did so because I feared Merlin, later because I loved you.
Who is, then?
I did, Father. I beg your forgiveness.
You freed it, son?
Sir... Kay needed a sword. His was stolen. I saw Excalibur, and... I took it.
Well hurry then, and get it.
I left it in the tent, sir.
I have kept it.

Forgive me, my wife, if you can. I was not born to live a man's life, but to be the stuff of future memory. The fellowship was a brief beginning, a fair time that cannot be forgotten; and because it will not be forgotten, that fair time may come again. Now once more I must ride with my knights to defend what was, and the dream of what could be.
I loved you much, as King, and sometimes as husband, but one cannot gaze too long at the sun in the sky.
And if he cannot be found, no other knight will champion me, though you beseeched each and every one of them. Why be king if there is no one you can call loyal subject but an eager boy?
The laws, my laws, must bind everyone, high and low, or they are not laws at all. Lancelot will come...
And you cannot love me...
If I am your judge, I cannot be your champion. When I act as your King, I cannot be your husband.
Why can't you be my champion?
Not you, my husband?
The Queen will be in my charge till a champion steps forward to fight on her behalf.

No. I meant not to be angry with you, Sir Gahalt. In the idleness that comes with peace gossip has bread its own evil. You merely repeat it. Please, sir, have one of those apples that Lancelot loves, and in that gesture partake of its goodness.
Sir Gahalt, answer the Queen.
Without Lancelot?!
Don't start a war on my wedding day!
I will ride with Sir Kay. Lancelot, rest here.
I grant you your wish if you grant Lady Guenevere hers.
He must stay for the feasting days of our wedding, and tell his deeds himself.
Quiet, or I'll sew up your mouth too.
I'm going.
No, I think it's better if you just stay here to heal. At least a week.
Well, then, I shall tell you which knights have maiden daughters, so you can avoid their castles.
I didn't know Leondegrance had a daughter.
--And damsels in besieged castles are waiting to be rescued?
But I have to leave tomorrow. The forests are thick with rebels, invaders plunder our shores...
--I'm pretty good at stitchery. I've sewn my father's wounds more than once.
Ye...
It didn't hurt too much, did it?
You and the land are one. Drink from the chalice. You will be reborn and the land with you.
I am wasting away and I cannot die. And I cannot live.
Because you and the land are one.
I have waited long for you. Once you almost saw, but fear blinded you. Why am I served from the chalice?
You, my lord.
Who does it serve?
We are to blame.
The King without his sword, the land without a king...
He has given up.
Why didn't he kill us?
--Nothing!
There are things about love--
Love demands it.
The law forbids it.
I cannot love as a woman the lady who will be wife to my King and my friend. And, in pledging my love to you, I cannot love any other woman.
To me? But why?
Yes. I would swear my love to you.
Me?
You.
Who?!
There is one.
And there is no maiden in the whole world who inspires you?
I am a fighting man and I am married to the quest. That is enough.
Why?
No.
The well-kept secret is whether any of them has won your heart.
--It must wait, child. These good ladies, for whom I intervened once, will honor me with a meal. I am beholden to them now as I was when they begged my protection.
I have found you. The Queen. An apple. Tomorrow. Sir Gawain...
Twenty days!? The world is that big?
Listen, boy, it's more than twenty days from here.
I will run.
Very well. Climb up.
You're a man?!  ...with metal skin!
Just a man. A knight in the King's service.
--I am the fog and mists that rise up from the sea, escaping...
--I am the sea, which covers the desert forever under its weight.
I am the desert, where water disappears--
I am the cloudburst that quenches the flames.
What's behind that beauty? A wizened, cold-hearted snake.
You provoke me, Merlin.
Walls of shining crystals, burning with red fire, furnishings of metals and jewels never seen by man...
What do you want? You must desire it for me to weave it.
I won't. You would misuse such power. I have paid enough for you, and I will have you.
Merlin, the powers of Summoning, the true Name of the charms of Doing and Undoing. Show me!

Flattery! Do you think I am ignorant of your stupid little games? Preying on you weakness of others. That's your power, a petty evil. Mine is great. Great plans. Impossible dreams. Laughable endings...
You are truly magnificent!
Why?
They do.
People make you laugh?
When Arthur built the castle, I carved out a place for myself, where I could laugh or sleep, and no one would bother me.
That I cannot.
You know what I want. I want the secret of true magic, how to thicken the stuff of dreams and wishes with the flesh of the world.
Maybe... maybe...
The deepest secrets, the forbidden formulas...
I showed you all my conjuring tricks...
Shh... yes, yes. Sit with me, please... Morgana.
A lovestruck page!
No. Yes, I am. I am jealous. I want to write poems about you with moonbeams, make the sea sing your name...
It's clear you are, and it irks me.
I'm not jealous!
No, no, of course not. You are young...
Can it truly be used for magic?
It is.
Is that Mandrake, Lord Merlin?
You left your husband's side? You left your brother's wedding?

They are not weapons, my friend, but truths. You betrayed the Duke, stole his wife and took his castle, now no one trusts you. Lot, Uryens, your allies will turn against you. Give me the child, Uther, I will protect him. Go back to your war tent.
You strike me with words as hard as steel.
Maybe not even that, Uther. I thought once that you were the one to unite the land under one sword. But it'll take another, a greater king...
To kill and be king, is that all?
It's not for you, Uther, hearth and home, wife and child.
You didn't ask!
The oath. You didn't say--
The child is mine, Uther. I have come for him.
I?
Now you must pay me.
Doing what I did for you, it wasn't easy, you know. It takes it's toll. It took nine moons to get back my strength.
Merlin! Out of the sick sleep at last.
I swear it.
--What issues from your lust will be mine. Swear it again.
I swear it. By Excalibur and the holy--
Dumb riddles, Merlin. I am your King.
I have walked my way since the beginning of time. Sometimes I give, sometimes I take. It is mine to know which, and when.
One land, one king! That is my peace!

Behold the sword of power, Excalibur. Before Uther, it belonged to Lud, before Lud, to Beowulf, before Beowulf to Baldur the Good, before Baldur to Thor himself and that was when the world was young and there were more than seven colors in the rainbow.  Speak the words.
Just show the sword.
I should butcher all and every one of them. Merlin, what is this wagging of tongues?
Talk. Lovers murmuring to each other...
It's done. A truce. We meet at the river.
You were supposed to be here half an hour ago...the emergency strategy session? Your trip to Aspen? They?re all panicked here...
Adelle?
Hey Santa, where are you? Everybody?s here.
Hello?
That'll be a nice little holiday treat.
I'll leave from the office tomorrow afternoon.  Call the group.  Schedule an emergency strategy session for noon.
She's probably just having a fit of nostalgia.  You know, lonely Christmas Eve, call the one that got away, that kind of thing.
No?!  You almost married this woman.  Aren't you even curious what she wants?
No...
And look where it's led you...  I'm gonna get her on the phone...
I took the road less traveled, Adelle.
Stop Jack, I'm getting all weepy.
God, no.  I thought about it for practically the entire flight...
So you left her?  Just like that?
She didn't want me to go to London.  We're standing at the airport saying goodbye and she asks me to stay.
Excuse me?
Almost married.  And almost a junior broker at E.F. Hutton...
You?  Married?
Kate Reynolds was my girlfriend in college.  I almost married her...
Yeah Jack, her assistant...
Her assistant?
Her assistant said you could call her at home after eight.
Kate Reynolds...
Ooh, my suits are ready...
Oh, and Oxxford called...
You're a ray of sunshine, Jack.
You too?  This holiday's about giving, Adelle.  And I'm giving everything I've got to this deal, so in a way, I'm more Christmassy than anyone...  Lifesaver?
So what are we gonna do, Jack?
No.
Is this another one of those Sun Tzu ?Art of War? tricks?
But I think I like you better this way...
Excuse me?

It?s not good.  Bob Thomas has secretly been talking to a European drug company. We?re not sure which one, Julia?s on it right now. Word is they?re willing to let him buy a minority stake and keep running the entire company.  The Global people are up in arms.  They say we should?ve been prepared for this.  We?re in trouble here, Jack...
What?s going on here?
Jack, are you okay?

Oh, I?m hearing you, Alan. That?s not the problem. The problem is that what you think is yours, is really mine.  And I don?t care how low on the totem pole I start, I will get it back...  So do yourself a favor and don?t get too attached to that view because sometime soon, maybe very soon, you and your French country antiques, your chintz sofa, and your little play pen are gonna be moving out of that office.
I don?t think you?re hearing me.
Good for you. Why shouldn?t you protect what?s yours.
Seven.  Really.
...that?s our war room. We did seven major deals last year, three of them hostile.
You drink about sixteen Diet Cokes a day. You?re an excellent father, but you feel guilty about the time you spend away from home. You drink bourbon, but you offer your clients scotch...
What about me?
Take you, for instance...
I?m sure you do...
And I know people.

It?s okay, Alan. I get it. I?m in your shoes, I?m thinking exactly the same thing...but here?s the thing. Business is business.  Wall Street, Main Street, it?s all just a bunch of people getting up in the morning, trying to figure out how the hell they?re gonna send their kids to college.  It?s just people...
I?m not trying to knock the tire business, Jack.

Look, I know our paltry little two million in sales is about what you spend on office supplies in a year.  And I know some regional trucking company account is nothing compared to a sixty billion dollar merger...
Really. So you?re projecting what, a tad over two million?
Well, Alan, I think we?re gonna have a banner year. Sales are up almost twenty percent in the first quarter and we just landed a major trucking company account.
Uh huh...one point seven. And what do you project for this year?
We did one point seven million in total revenue...
Mind if I ask what kind of sales you did last year? Ballpark...
Uh...we actually get about sixty percent of our business from automotive service.
Uh huh. The retail end, I understand.
That?s right. And auto supply...
A broker? Really. And now you?re in the tire business?
I was a sales associate, at E.F. Hutton.
Uh...actually, yes. Two... good ones.
You have kids, Jack?
I can see that, Alan.
Please, call me Alan. We try to cultivate a casual atmosphere around here...
Mr. Mintz.
Because my gift comes with ten zeroes at the end...
Why Jack?
I don't want you to be sorry, Alan, I want you to be excited.  I want my gift to be the first one you open this year.  You know why?
You're right, Jack.  Sorry... Jack approaches Alan.
I don't know.  Maybe...
You think I like being here on Christmas Eve, Alan?
Is that tonight?
Sorry, Jack.  I told Dee and the kids I'd be home by dinner.  You know, it being Christmas Eve and all.
I?m not worried, Mom. He?s still learning our ways...
Fighting?s a part of it, Annie.  You know that, right?
That?s right.  Okay, let?s make a quick stop at the kids? shoe department, pick up my watch from the battery place, then I?ll run into the linen store...
Mary Janes, Mom.  You promised.
We?re almost done here...
Mommy needs five more minutes in la la land. That could be her present...
Mom, don?t you think we need to open the presents?
You?re jumping, sweetheart...
Rise...and...shine...!
No, honey. Go back to sleep.
Is it morning yet?
Ringing my bell...
What are you doing?
Ah. A classic...
Mary Had A Little Lamb.
Very nice. What is it?
Right.  That?s a major oversight...  So if I?m Kate...I can?t really afford the finer things, my husband?s career is a crushing disappointment to me, I?m trapped in suburbia...
That?s good but...you did forget the anniversary.
Maybe there?s a jewelry store back at the mall. I could get her a pair of earrings or something.
Mom liked it.
Don?t you think that?s a little gimmicky?
One year he had a solar system named after her...
Like what?
Not bad...I shoulda warned you.  Dad always does something really special for their anniversary.
That?s where you work.
Big Ed?s?  Big Ed?s Tires?  Why...?
Big Ed?s.
Where do I go now?
Bye...
Got it.  Good tip.
Try not to be late because kids don?t like to be the last one picked up.
Five thirty.  Okay.
I have winter camp until four, then ballet until five thirty.
Check...
This is day care.  It?s where babies go when their parents are at work.
Sure.
You promise not to kidnap me and my brother and implant stuff in our brains?
I think I could figure it out.
You know how to make chocolate milk?
On a case by case basis...
Do you like kids?
Uhh...thanks...slightly better looking though, right?
The aliens...In the mother ship.  You look just like him.
Who did?
They did a pretty good job.
I don?t know...
Where?s my real dad?
This isn?t my real life. It?s just a glimpse...
Yeah...I guess I just wanted you to know, we could?ve been really good friends...
You never really talked to me.  I wanted to talk to you, man...
Yes, that?s it...yes, we went to high school together.
Of course. Jack Campbell. I went to high school with you...you played baseball, right?  You?re doing well...
Yes...Jack Campbell...
Wait a second...  Jack...Jack...
I never won anything in bowling.
We bowl together. We?re bowlers ...we won a championship...we?re winners.
How?d you know my name?
Tell me you recognize me, Arnie.  Please...
I don?t care if you?re Tim Allen with your fancy car and all your tools, you still can?t park here.
It?s me, Jack...
Hey, you can?t park that thing here.
It?s your birthday? Today?  What?s your name?  Where were you born?
So Jack, it?s your wife?s birthday, got anything to say to her?
All I?m saying it there isn?t a guy in Union County who wouldn?t give his left nut to be married to Kate...
Hey, is that really necessary?
C?mon, Evelyn Thompson?s got no class.  She doesn?t marry Dr. Steve, the woman?s living in a trailer.
Screw the rules.  I?m talking about the choice.
I?m telling you, those rules don?t apply to me, Arn.

Look, maybe I?m not as good a consigliere as you are but you have to trust me on this one.  A little flirtation?s harmless but you?re playing with fire here.  The Fidelity Bank and Trust is a tough creditor.  You make a deposit somewhere else, they close your account forever.
It wouldn?t really be cheating...  It?s complicated.
Whoa...whoa...wait a second, Jack.  You?re not actually gonna cheat on Kate?
So could you write down her exact address?
Oh yeah...  What is it about you?
Pretty much.
She said that?
She wants to have an affair with me.
She is relentless.
I just saw Evelyn Thompson.
Hey Jack, you?re all flush.  I guess that seventy-one took a lot outta you.
You?re right.  Why am I so competitive!? Compensation, I guess. Look, just focus, Jack. You can still pick up the spare...
Hey, I?m doing the best I can...  I?d like to see you hit a squash ball after seventeen beers...
Where?s your follow through?  Where?s your stance?
Jesus, Jack, this is a league match, for god?s sake!
Damn...
It?s just two kids, right?

Look, you fit the profile exactly.  Thirties, house, kids, financial responsibilities.  You start thinking...this isn?t the life I dreamt about.  Where?s the romance, where?s the joie de vivre?  Suddenly, every lingerie ad in the Newark Star Ledger represents a life you can?t have...
Kate?s my wife...
You see, it?s like we?re in each other?s heads...
It?s not Kate, is it?
I don?t think so.
Trouble at work?
Is it...?
What am I saying?  You don?t need to hear that...  All I meant was a lot of people have a hard time dealing with all the forced reverie, that?s all.  Is that you?
I read somewhere that the suicide rate doubles during the holidays...
I?m having kind of a bad day.
Maybe I don?t say it enough but you moving in next door to me...
We?re friends, aren?t we?
Great room...
I know, I moved the Barca-lounger into the corner.  It?s throwin? everybody off.  What do you think?
I mean it.  From what I can tell, we?re a mom and pop operation, we?re already over-extended in sales, and any price advantage we could offer would easily be matched by a larger supplier...
C?mon Jack...
I?ve got all the time in the world...
Got a minute, Jack?
The Caddy?  Why don?t you take your own damn car!
Look, can I just borrow your car?!  I promise it?ll be returned!
What the hell are you talking about?  What?s he talking about?
Where?s my car?!  Where?s my Ferrari!?
You know what the word glimpse means, J? It?s by nature an impermanent thing.
I?ve got kids, I?m going home...
C?mon, Jack...
You can?t do this. You can?t keep coming in and out of people?s lives, messing things up...
Look Jack I?m late.  I?d love to help you out some more but I gotta go handle my business...  Happy trails.
But what do I do?
Do I look like I live in a bottle?
What?s this, a signal? Will you come whenever I ring it?
Look Jack, in my experience the best way people deal with this is to just relax and breathe through it...let it come to you.
That?s it?  That?s all I get?!  A glare?!
Figure it out?  Figure what out?!
Because you got to figure it out for yourself.  Are you listening to me?
Why not?
Do I look like I need your money.  It doesn?t work like that and I can?t tell you why.
Look, I just want my life back.  Now what?s it gonna take?  You wanna talk turkey?  Let?s talk turkey!  How much money...?
As long as it takes to figure it out.  Which, in your case, could be considerable.
How much time?!
Figure it out.  You got plenty of time.
I asked you a direct question!  A glimpse of what?!
Look, eventually, everybody gets one...some of ?em take a couple seconds...  ...some of ?em take a lot longer...
I glimpse?  A glimpse of what!?  What glimpse?! Glimpse!
It?s a glimpse, Jacko.
Please.  Just tell me what?s happening to me. In plain English.  None of that mumbo jumbo...
You?  What about me?  I?m working hard for you here, Jack.  On Christmas too!  Now you did a good thing last night, intervening that way.  I was moved...
Give me my goddamn life back!
Everyone else in that store is a statue, they see their lives passing in front of their eyes, but not you.  You?re making a business deal...
You mean because you thought I was cocky I?m now on a permanent acid trip?!!
No?  C?mon, Jack...I?ve got everything I need, I don?t have regrets, that?s just not for me... sound familiar?
Brought what on myself?! I didn?t do anything!
Look, I don?t know what you?re getting so worked up about, you did this...you brought this on yourself.
What the hell is happening to me?!
Might wanna fasten your seat belt, Jack...
Basically, it?s my car now.  Get in.
What?!
It?s a callable asset seized in accordance with the acquisition by-laws of your alt-fate contract...
That?s my car!  You stole my car!
Miss me, Jack?
Oh man, I'm gonna enjoy this one... Just remember, Jack, you did this.  You brought this on yourself...
Sure it's about you.  But it's about society, too.
You still think this is about me, don't you?
Look, I'm not saying you'd be able to do it without some hard work...
Wow.  It must be great being you.  You got it all.
I've got everything I need.
You just said everyone needs something.
Me?
Yeah?  What do you need?
Everyone needs something.
Oh man, you're serious...  This man thinks I need to be saved!
Wait a minute, wait a minute... you're tryin' to save me?
I mean there must be programs out there, opportunities...
Yeah, in most cases that'd be true.
I'm just saying that you seem like a smart guy.  At a certain point you're gonna do something, and then there's no turning back...
You want to talk about regrets, you're talking to the wrong person.
What do you want to carry that gun around for, anyway? You're just gonna do something you'll regret...
Hey...
Okay, Jack.  Nice doing business with you... Cash is about to take off...
I don't do that.  That's just not for me...
So you're telling me, you've got a gun to your head and you don't think for one second, what if this, what if that, maybe I shouldn't do this, I shoulda done that.
A lucky streak, huh?
There's no way I was gonna die in that deli...  Let's just say I've been on a lucky streak lately.
You know you seem pretty relaxed for a guy who just had a gun pulled on him.
I call all you white guys "Jack."
How'd you know my name was Jack?
Damn, you are the real thing...
Like I said, it's a business deal...

Look, I'm talking about a business deal here.  I buy the ticket for two hundred, take it to a store where the guy behind the counter...  ...doesn't have a death wish  ...I just made myself a quick thirty eight dollars.
Yes you do...
No.

Are we finally being honest?
Is there something going on between us?

Are we...?

Need a nurse?
Something like that.
Very funny.  I saw you out there on lane five. What do you have the flu or something?
Evelyn, right?

Frank.  Where?s Alan Mintz?  Is he here yet?
